title: okita_j._souji_(fate)
body:
Swimsuit Assassin-class version of [[Okita Souji (fate)|]], first appearing in the [[Kenzan! Las Vegas Gozenjiai]] event. Wears a [[black bikini]] with a [[black scarf]] around her neck in her first two ascensions, and a [[white bikini]] in her third. The J in her name stands for "jet", in reference to the [[jetpack]] strapped to her back.

The jetpack is [[Servant Universe (fate)|]] technology that was affixed to her back as a form of life support after [[Mysterious Heroine XX (fate)|]] mistakenly believed she killed her. Because of this, she has a low rank Existence Outside the Domain skill reserved for Foreigner-class servants. Conversely, her Weak Constitution skill has been removed, allowing for superior combat abilities.

For her Alter variant's swimsuit version, see [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yuuki Aoi]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #9206303: [[Okita J. Souji (First Ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]]

title: guild_no_uketsukejou_desu_ga_zangyou_wa_iya_nanode_boss_wo_solo_toubatsu_shiyou_to_omoimasu
body:
A fantasy light novel written by "Kousaka Mato":[https://x.com/mato52242844] (香坂マト) and illustrated by [[Gaou (umaiyo puyoman)|]] about... a guild receptionist who would solo any boss to clock out on time.  

On July 23, 2025 all volumes of the series was pulled by the publisher to be rereleased at a later time with a new illustrator due to the scandal involving the original illustrator.

title: rod_of_remorse
body:
A [[ritual baton]] used by [[Enma (mythology)|]] to carry out Judgments of Death upon the deceased who traverse the Higan and cross the Sanzu River, where no living being can go.

Used by [[Shiki Eiki]] of the [[Touhou]] series. Not to be confused with [[ritual baton]]s used by others (such as [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]'s baton) which have a similar shape but are different objects.

h4.See also

* [[ritual baton]]

title: ninamori_eri
body: Ninamori Eri ([[FLCL]]) is the daughter of the mayor of Mabase and the president of [[nandaba_naota|Naota's]] sixth grade class. Ninamori is a complex character like Naota. She is obsessed with acting grown-up, but she often loses her composure when angry or excited. Ninamori hides her frustration with her father's sex scandal, and rigs an election for the school play so that she gets the lead role while Naota gets cast opposite her, hinting that she has a crush on him.

title: osakabehime_(fate)
body:
An Assassin-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Halloween Strike!]] event. Osakabe-Hime is a youkai that haunts the walls of Himeji Castle, and a friend of [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate)|]] and [[Kiyohime (fate)|]]. While she uses a [[bat (animal)|]] motif, Osakabe is actually a kitsune that attained human form (and also notes that it would be confusing if there were two kitsune Servants in the game). She is also a massive [[hikikomori]], and has the ability to control the [[origami]] animals she creates.

Appearance-wise, Osakabe has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] [[gradient hair|fading into]] [[brown hair|brown]] tips that she wears in [[twintails]], [[purple eyes]], and wears [[glasses]]. Her standard outfit is a kimono-themed [[hoodie]] and a [[purple skirt]]. Due to her dialogue in her swimsuit variants, she is also often depicted with a [[plump]] body.

She has a [[osakabehime (swimsuit archer) (fate)|swimsuit version]] for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Moriyama Daisuke]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Fukuen Misato]]

title: soda_fountain
body:
A soda fountain or postmix machine is a device for dispensing [[soda|carbonated soft drinks]].  They typically consist of a boxy device featuring multiple dispenser heads and a drip tray beneath them.  They may feature an ice cube dispenser in the middle of the device.  The machine makes carbonated soft drinks by combining flavored syrups, water, and carbon dioxide.  They're common in fast food restaurants and concession stands.

The drinks dispensed by a soda fountain are called a "fountain drink."

They're named after small eating establishments that used to serve carbonated drinks by a "soda jerk," a person who mixed flavored syrups with carbonated water.

h4. Examples

* !asset #29149186
* !post #9350036

h4. See also

* [[Beverage dispenser]] 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Soda fountain":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soda_fountain]

title: beverage_dispenser
body:
An apparatus that dispenses flavored [[drink|beverages]] other than water.  The beverages are premixed and typically served cold.
It consists of a vessel connected with a faucet. Most designs are meant to be placed on table, and sometimes they have an [[ice]] chamber inside.

title: one_world_trade_center
body:
The replacement for the [[World Trade Center]] that was destroyed by the terrorist attacks on [[9/11|September 11, 2001]]. Formerly called the Freedom Tower. 

The building was opened in 2014 and is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. It is located near where the original Twin Towers once stood.

title: manimani_(vocaloid)
body:
A song by the [[VOCALOID]] producer [[r-906]]. Features main vocals by [[Hatsune Miku]] and backup vocals by [[IA (Vocaloid)|]] and [[KAFU (CeVIO)|]]. The title, まにまに, means to be at the mercy of something (wind, the waves, gods, etc.). Much of the lyrics may be inspired by lines from [i]Hyakunin Isshu[/i], a classical Japanese anthology consisting of 100 poems by 100 poets.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid songs]]
* [[List of vocal synth songs]]

* "NicoNico: まにまに / 初音ミク":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm40349788]

title: inverted_cross
body:
An upside-down † symbol, generally a [[Latin cross]]. Also called St. Peter's Cross.

Contemporary usage is associated with [[occult|Satanism]] or [[blasphemy|anti-Christianity]]. It originally represented the [[christianity|Christian]] legend of how St. Peter was [[crucifixion|crucified]] upside-down because he felt unworthy to be crucified in the same manner as [[Jesus]] Christ.

h4. Related characters bearing the symbol
* [[Horikawa Raiko]]
* [[Koakuma]]
* [[Satanichia Kurumizawa McDowell]]
* [[Shiroko (blue archive)]]
* [[Suigintou]]

h4. See also

* [[pentagram]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

In this costume, she wears a [[black jacket]] worn over a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[yellow neckerchief]], [[white pants]], [[black gloves]] and [[black boots|black]] [[cowboy boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, has cut her [[long hair]] [[short hair|short]] and is now [[spiked hair|spiky]] and has a [[x hair ornament]].

title: rejection_reaction_(meme)
body:
A facial expression of amazement and shock.

During an [[Apex Legends]] stream, [[Dokibird]] was grouped up with two other players who knew each other and were talking in voice chat.

The atmosphere started somewhat intimate with Dokibird quietly listening in on the conversation, until one person asked if the other one was still with someone else.

The answer was "[I]Yeah. He is right next to me [...][/I]" at which point the atmosphere dramatically shifted to awkward. The clip went viral, with Doki's exaggerated expression becoming a topic of redraws and discussion about advancements in VTuber model tracking.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22681911: Origin

h4. External links

* "YouTube:【PC STRESS TEST】i ended up with 2 different sets of faulty ram【Dokibird】@ 37:50":[https://www.youtube.com/live/wEHNmDagYGQ?&t=2270]
* "Twitter: i can't believe me and my chat just watch a man get rejected live on apex legends 🍺drinks out for that guy":[https://twitter.com/dokibird/status/1821417055033180304]

title: vgumiho
body:
[[minecraft youtube|Minecraft]] and variety Twitch streamer and [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Regular participant of [[MC Championship]] and a close friend of [[Dokibird]].

Hosted Pummel Party Saturdays, a series of streams where her and her friends play the titular party game. She also participated in the second [[Quackity SMP]] [[purgatory (quackity smp)|]] event.

Her persona is a [[dog girl]] with long [[brown hair|brown]] and [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]]. She wears a red [[kepi]] and a [[black dress]], and a [[black choker]] with a pink [[heart]] decoration.

title: dragoon_(dokibird)
body:
[[dokibird|Dokibird]]'s fanbase, portrayed as small birds. Formerly known as Bark Knights. According to Dokibird, the term was based on a "mounted infantry unit":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragoon] during the early 17th century, and a Protoss unit from the game [[StarCraft]]. She drew several designs for them live on stream.

The name for the fanbase is [[dragoon (selen tatsuki)|shared with]], and actually derived from her previous persona [[Selen Tatsuki]]'s fanbase.

title: snuffy_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[virtual YouTuber]] affiliated with [[3AM]]'s 3rd Generation, streaming as an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] prior to joining. Closely associated with [[Vei (vtuber)|]], [[Laimu (vtuber)|]], and [[VShojo]] girls.

She is a [[punk]] [[goth fashion|goth]] [[raccoon girl]]. Was previously a [[pink hair|pink]] [[cat girl]].

When streaming with [[Laimu (vtuber)|]], [[Mint Fantome]], and [[Dokibird]], they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

title: ying_swei_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Imperial Chinese Navy protected cruiser [i]Ying Swei[/i]/[i]Ying Rui[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character designed by [[yyy (zelda10010)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] ([[purple hair|purple]] and [[white hair|white]]) tied into [[double bun|two]] [[cone hair bun]]s, [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her outfit is basically the same as her sister, replacing the red color dress with [[purple dress|purple]] and her [[single thighhigh]] is on her right leg.

In the game, she and her sister [[Chao Ho (Azur Lane)|]] are reclassed as light cruisers to conform to existing ship types. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4342806: Default

title: chao_ho_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Imperial Chinese Navy protected cruiser [i]Chao Ho[/i] in [[Azur Lane]], the name ship and lead ship of her class. Character designed by [[yyy (zelda10010)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] ([[red hair|red]] and [[white hair|white]]) tied into [[double bun|two]] [[cone hair bun]]s, [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit is an unorthodox [[chinese clothes|Cheongsam]] with a white inner dress and [[detached sleeves]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]], and red [[high heels]].

In the game, she and her sister [[Ying Swei (Azur Lane)|]] are reclassed as light cruisers to conform to existing ship types.

title: senshi_(dungeon_meshi)
body:
[i][[Dungeon Meshi]][/i] character.

He is a [[dwarf]] with [[black hair]], a [[mustache]], and a beard depicted as [[long beard|long]] or [[very long beard|very long]]. He wears a [[horned helmet]], [[leather]] [[kilt]] and [[bracer]]s. His eyes are often drawn as [[black eyes|black]] [[solid circle pupils]].

He is sometimes depicted with a [[knife]] or [[cooking pot]].

h4. Official art
* !asset #29144366

h4. Trivia
* He's well-versed in preparing food from monsters and other ingredients found in the dungeon, and is adamant that the party always eat nutritiously. 
* Like most dwarves in the series, he wears little armor, because while dwarves are stronger than their larger "tallmen" counterparts, they tire quickly (likely from a combination of short legs and more muscular torsos leaving less room for their hearts and lungs) and aren't suited to carrying large loads for a long time.
* He carries a mithril cooking knife and adamantine cooking pot, which any other dwarf would likely consider a sacrilegious misuse of said materials.

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/573ff44a-0a01-453e-954f-cfcae230a200]

title: chilchuck_tims
body:
Chilchuck is an [[halfling]] adventurer in [[Dungeon Meshi]]. He's one of the main protagonists, and handles locked doors and traps on the party's behalf. He has [[brown hair]], [[black eyes]], and wears [[leather armor]], [[black pants]], [[fingerless gloves]], and a green [[neck warmer]].

He has 3 daughters: [[Mayjack (dungeon meshi)|]], [[Fullertom (dungeon meshi)|]], and [[Packpatty (dungeon meshi)|]].

h4. Official art
* !asset #29144352


h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/4469be82-0247-4302-a096-b9f932663fa2/1]
other_names: チルチャック・ティムズ

title: falin_touden
body:
[[Dungeon Meshi]] character.

A [[falin touden (tallman)|tallman]] spellcaster, [[Laios Touden]]'s younger sister and [[Marcille Donato]]'s classmate. Her rescue is the main goal of the party. She saved the party from total defeat at the jaws of a red [[dragon]] by teleporting them away, but was eaten herself. [spoilers]The party killed the dragon and resurrected her, but she was turned into [[falin touden (chimera)|a chimera]] by the [[thistle (dungeon meshi)|mad sorcerer]].[/spoilers]

Like her brother, she has [[brown eyes]] (although they are often [[closed eyes|closed]]) and [[grey hair|platinum]]-[[blonde hair|blonde]] hair. Her adventuring garb includes a [[blue headwear|blue hat]] and [[blue robe|blue]]-and-[[white robe]], and she wields a [[mace]] that resembles a street light.

h4. Official art
* !asset #29144345

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/54ff722f-bb04-4fdf-97d1-6ea50585992e/1]

title: laios_touden
body:
[i][[Dungeon Meshi]][/i] character.

The leader of the party, Laios is a "tallman" (human). He is exceptionally knowledgeable about (and fascinated with) monsters. However, he's very awkward on an interpersonal level; frequently misunderstanding, annoying, or even unintentionally frightening other characters. As the physically largest member of the party, he wields a [[sword]] and wears [[plate armor|a full suit of armor]] to serve as the party's tank.

He has [[brown eyes]] and [[grey hair|platinum]]-[[blonde hair|blonde]] hair, usually worn [[short hair|short]].

[[falin touden|Falin]] is his sister.

h4. Official art
* !asset #29144315

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/478a9373-5347-4e33-83b3-4e3ee336f355]

title: jenette_vasquez
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Aliens (1986)|]] [[science fiction]] and horror film from the 80s.

[b]Specialist First Class Jenette Vasquez[/b] is a very capable [[space marine]] from the [[Colonial Marine]] Corps.

Her weapon of choice is the [[M56 Smartgun]] squad support weapon.

She was played by actress Jenette Goldstein, who ironically, is not Hispanic in real life but a fair-skinned Jewish-American woman.

title: pripara
body:
A Japanese arcade game by Takara Tomy. It is the successor of the [[Pretty Rhythm]] series of arcade games and the second entry in the [[Pretty Series]]. An anime television series adaptation, comprising three seasons, aired from 2014 to 2017. A second animation adaption, [[Idol Time PriPara]], premiered in 2017 and a mobile game, [[Idol Land PriPara]], was released in 2023 along with a web anime. PriPara also inspired four anime films. PriPara itself is succeeded by [[Kiratto Pri Chan]].

title: waverider_crash
body:
[[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|Zeta Gundam]]'s trademark finishing move, first seen used in the final episode of its [[Zeta Gundam|eponymous show]] and commonly featured as the unit's strongest attack in [[Super Robot Wars]]. 

In [[wave rider|Waverider]] Mode, the Zeta Gundam does a high-speed ramming maneuver onto its target, which is rendered unable to move by the former's Biosensor System. The Biosensor also uses the spirits of the deceased (usually those of who have a relationship with the pilot such as friends or even enemies) to boost the power of this attack. Associated with [[watermelon bar|watermelon bars]] due to the combination of colors.

[spoilers]Zeta's pilot [[Kamille Bidan]] uses this move to kill [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who was prior to this, untouchable in combat thanks to his Newtype powers, piloting skill and the speed and tough armor of his [[The O (mobile Suit)|]] [[mobile suit]]. Despite decisively winning using this move, it became Kamille's undoing due to Scirocco being able to hit him with a mind-crippling psychic attack at close proximity with his dying breath, that turned him [[ptsd|insane]] afterwards (and becoming a [[vegetative_state|vegetable]] at the start of [[Gundam ZZ]]).[/spoilers]

This tag is also used for the exaggerated facial expression Scirocco makes during the scene.
other_names: ウェイブライダー突撃

title: agano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Agano[/i], the name ship of her class. Character design by [[Hecha (01964237)|]], voiced by [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice Actor)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied by a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] to a long [[ponytail]], with [[red eyes]]. She also wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] (with prominent [[long sleeves]]), [[pantyhose]], and a [[black skirt]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 15.2 cm twin gun mounts and two 61 cm quadruple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side but her torpedoes are attached to her waist.

title: gnosia
body:
A werewolf-style social deduction role-playing game developed by Petit Depotto. It is avaliable on PlayStation Vita, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S and PC.

The player has woken up in a spaceship with no memories, the player and several NPCs must deduce who on board is a Gnosia, an alien-like creature that will kill the regular humans on board. The player works with the NPCs to suss out and nominate the potential Gnosia suspects and put them into cryo-sleep. The player can also be Gnosia, in which case they know the other Gnosia on board and will work together to try to eliminate the humans. The number of Gnosia as well as the number of NPCs on board as well as the player's role, is determined prior to each loop beginning. In addition to regular humans and Gnosia, there are other roles, including the Doctor (who can investigate the recently frozen NPCs and determine if they were human or not), the Engineer (who can investigate non-frozen characters to determine if they are human), the Guardian Angel (who can protect high-risk targets from elimination by the Gnosia), and the Bug (who is essentially playing for themselves, trying to stay alive to the end of the round and seizing victory for themselves, destroying the universe).

title: az_(pokemon)
body:
A major character that appears in [[pokemon_xy|Pokémon X and Y]]. He was once the king of the Kalos region, but he appears in the story as a lone, incredibly tall wanderer.

3000 years prior to the game's events, he created a machine to revive his [[Floette (eternal)|]], which had died in action during a war that broke out at the time. Overcome by despair, he turned machine into the ultimate weapon that eliminated both sides of the war, bringing it to an end. The after-effects of this weapon granted him and his Pokémon immortality. Knowing that the weapon used the life energy of other Pokémon, the Floette parted ways with him.

He is set to return in [[Pokemon legends: z-a|Pokémon Legends: Z-A]] as the owner of Hotel Z, the place in which the protagonist stays at after arriving to [[Lumiose City]].

H4. See also 
* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/AZ

title: grenade
body:
A small [[explosive]] bomb thrown by hand.

Most grenades are timed and only armed if the lever strikes the propellant inside of one, after the pin is pulled away.

For the ammunition used for modern [[grenade launcher]]s, see [[40mm grenade]].

This tag is for lethal grenades. For non-lethal counterparts, see [[flashbang]] or [[smoke grenade]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #29095842: [[Mk2 grenade]] 

h4. Types

* [[F-1 grenade (soviet)|]]
* [[M26 grenade]]
* [[M67]]
* [[Mk2 grenade]]
* [[RG-42]]
* [[stick grenade]]
** [[bundled charge]]
** [[RGD-33]]
** [[Stielhandgranate]]
* [[thermite grenade]]

h4. See also

title: mk2_grenade
body:
A fragmentation-type anti-personnel hand [[grenade]] introduced by the [[United States]] [[military]] in 1918. It was the standard issue anti-personnel grenade used during [[World War II]], and also saw limited service in later conflicts, including the [[Korean War]] and [[Vietnam War]]. It replaced the failed Mk 1 grenade of 1917. The grooves and knobs gave the Mk 2 appearance of a [i][[pineapple]][/i], and are the origin of the nickname.

It was gradually phased out of service as the [[m26 grenade|M26]]-series grenade was introduced during the Korean War. Due to the tremendous quantity manufactured during WWII, the Mk 2 was still in limited issue with the [[united states army|US Army]] and [[united states marine corps|US Marine Corps]] throughout the 1950s and 1960s. 

h4. Examples

* !asset #29095842

h4. See also

* [[list of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mk 2 grenade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mk_2_grenade]

title: m67
body:
A fragmentation hand [[grenade]] used by the United States military, which was a replacement for the [[M26 grenade]]s used during the Korean and Vietnam Wars, and the older [[Mk2 grenade]]s used since [[World War I]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M67 grenade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M67_grenade]

title: m26_grenade
body:
A fragmentation hand [[grenade]] developed by the [[United States]] [[military]]. It entered service around 1952 and was first used in combat during the [[Korean War]].

Its distinct [[lemon]] shape led it to being nicknamed the "[[lemon]] grenade" (compare the [[Soviet]] [[F-1 grenade (soviet)|]] with similar nickname).

The grenade was developed as a result of studies on the [[Mk2 grenade]]. The M26 series was created after [[World War II]] to meet criticisms of the Mk 2. It was replaced by the M33 series grenade (M33/[[M67]] at the end of the [[Vietnam War]].

h4. See also

title: crossdressing
body:
Wearing clothing traditionally reserved for the opposite sex (e.g. men wearing [[dress]]es, women wearing [[tuxedo]]s, etc.)

This is distinct from (but often overlaps with) [[trap]], which specifically refers to a male convincingly appearing as a female. The crossdressing tag also handles both [[crossdressing (ftm)|females in male clothing]], and [[crossdressing (mtf)|males in female clothing]] who aren't fooling anyone.

[[Futanari]] and [[futa without pussy]] are considered to be crossdressing if they are wearing men's clothing.

title: ar-15
body:
An American semi-automatic [[rifle]] designed in 1956 by Eugene Stoner and L. James Sullivan, based on the [[AR-10]]. AR stands for [b]ArmaLite[/b], its original manufacturer. The early design feature a top-mounted charging handle inside the carry handle. Its selective fire variant was eventually adopted by the U.S. military as the M16. 

Predominantly available in .223/5.56mm caliber, the rifle enjoys huge popularity for its accuracy, and controllable recoil, as well as modular and customizable design despite surrounding controversies. It is manufactured and marketed by multiple companies.

This tag includes any variant of the AR-15, except for AR-based military rifles such as the [[M16]], [[Colt Commando]], [[M4 Carbine]], or [[h&k hk416|HK416]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #29093208

h4. See also

* [[ST AR-15 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[Colt 9mm SMG]]

title: p90
body:
A [[bullpup]] [[submachine gun]], developed between 1986–1987 by Stéphane Ferrard at [[FN Herstal]]. It fires 5.7×28mm ammunition that resembles miniature rifle rounds, with more velocity and armour-piercing capability compared to conventional pistol rounds. The P90 introduced the PDW (Personal Defense Weapon) concept.

The [[weapon]] has a distinct futuristic appearance, ambidextrous controls, downwards [[casing ejection]], integrated [[optical sight|optics]] in the carry [[handle]] with backup iron sights on its top and feeds from an axially-mounted 50-round magazine.

h4. See also

title: mkb42
body:
The [b]Mkb42[/b] ([i]Maschinenkarabiner 42[/i] "machine carbine model 1942") was an early German [[assault rifle]] designed in 1940-1941 during [[World War II]]. It was initially designed by Walther, hence it was known as Maschinenkarabiner 42(W) or Mkb42(W). The more successful one was designed by Haenel, hence Maschinenkarabiner 42(H) or Mkb42(H). Chambered in 7.92×33mm Kurz, both were predecessors of the famous [[Stg44]].

Visually speaking, the Mkb42 has longer, thicker gas tube that extends above the barrel compared to StG44.

title: arthur_leywin
body:
The main protagonist of [[The Beginning After The End]]. In his previous life, he was a king named Grey before he was reincarnated into a new world, on the continent of Dicathen.

In his former world, he lived as a king who stood on the top of his country in terms of combat, until he was presumably assassinated through poison one day. However, after living four years as Arthur Leywin, he reawoke as King Grey, as if he wasn't poisoned.

After being reincarnated into the Leywin Family, Grey decided that, unlike his previous life, he would live his life to the fullest. To be loved, and surrounded by the friends and family he was void of in his past life.

h4. External links

title: gensokyo_odyssey
body:
A [[Touhou]] satire visual novel released on April 16, 2024 by [[Kronington]], after three years in the making. It [[parody|parodies]] common tropes in other Touhou fan media and fan interpretations of characters infused with some early [[zoomer slang|Gen Z]] humor.

Features both animated and live-action skits, numerous pop culture and meme references relevant to early Gen Z, borderline insane dialogue and character interactions, and the most protagonist of all time, all while still telling its own story, having a unique minigame gimmick of having the [[danmaku]] be done through [[air hockey]], and a soundtrack composed by Kronington consisting of remixes in various genres and styles, as well as a few completely original songs.

It also features an original character, [[Kakkoi Elbertson]].

h4. External Links

* "Steam: Gensokyo Odyssey":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/1865670/Gensokyo_Odyssey/]

title: tog_ii
body:
The TOG2 (Tank, Heavy, TOG II*) is a British [[World War II]] prototype super-heavy tank. It is notable for it's long hull length (10 meters) and overall size.

The TOG2 was designed early in the war to overcome [[World War I]] style trench warfare, though it's intended operating conditions never materialized and it was quickly obsolete. It was designed by the Special Vehicle Development Committee (nicknamed "The Old Gang"), which consisted of people who had worked on the [[Mark I Tank]].

The TOG2 became somewhat famous after it's inclusion as a premium tank in [[World of Tanks]], where it was easily recognizable for its size and bulky shape. It was generally known for being large and slow, but with a good gun and very high hit point pool.

The single prototype of the TOG2 can be seen at the Tank Museum in Bovington, England.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: TOG2":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TOG2"

title: tteoguji
body: Traditional Korean headdress worn during the [[Joseon Dynasty]]. Worn by queens and crown princesses for formal attire. It resembles two large hair rings, of which flop over the scalp diagonally. It is one of many styles of carved-wood wig ornaments in Korea, called gache (加髢). It was usually made from paulownia, a lightweight wood, and engraved with braid patterns. h4. External links * "Google Arts and Culture: Tteo-guji, Wooden Wig":[https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/tteo-guji-wooden-wig-unkown/JwGC9ZnHIoBmkw?hl=en]

title: otaku
body:
A person obsessed with any subject, whether anime, manga, [[comic]]s, entertainment, [[video game]]s, electronics, [[toy]]s, trains, vehicles, weapons, [[history]], etc.

The term started as a derogatory term in [[Japan]] during the late 70s towards anti-social people who are highly fixated over a particular subject or person, but has since evolved (in the West mostly) to imply a cool, eccentric individual with particularly unique hobbies or interests. However, depictions of generic otaku as an "unhealthily obsessive fan" stock character remains in widespread uses in media (especially in Japan). In the West, otaku are often conflated with Western nerds, to the point of the term being used as a synonym, but each have their own specific differences socially and culturally. For the purposes of Danbooru though, they are one and the same. 

Tag what you see: The tag is only applicable if the image shows their otakuness/nerdiness.

title: s4u_hokkaido_trip_camper_van_rollover_incident_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] born out of a [[car crash|traffic accident]] involving the Japanese [[Niconico]]/[[Youtube]] streamer group S4/S4U and their friends on their trip to Hokkaido. During the incident, the entire camper van they were riding in rolled over on its side on the expressway, though miraculously they all made it out alive with only minor injuries at worst.

Because of the appearance of the group (all resembling stereotypical [[otaku]]s), how jinxed that the incident happened on the first day of their trip, and the fact that the accident happened shortly after they were joking about traffic accidents (death flag ahoy!), the video instantly achieved memetic cult status on the Japanese internet and has since become memed and parodied in various media.

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Original incident":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mbSDedSOZu8].

title: caldari_state_(eve_online)
body:
One of the four major factions in [[EVE Online]].

Founded on the tenets of patriotism and hard work that carried its ancestors through hardships on an inhospitable homeworld, the Caldari State is today a corporate dictatorship, led by rulers who are determined to see it return to the meritocratic ideals of old. Ruthless and efficient in the boardroom as well as on the battlefield, the Caldari are living emblems of strength, persistence, and dignity.

They favor [[missile]]s and hybrid [[turret]]s. Their playstyle prioritizes [[energy barrier|shields]] over speed.

h4. External links

* "Official Website: Caldari":https://universe.eveonline.com/empires/caldari
* "EVE University Wiki: Caldari State":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Caldari_State

title: amarr_empire_(eve_online)
body:
One of the four major factions in [[EVE Online]].

The Amarr Empire, a theocratic monarchy, is the largest nation in New Eden. It is known for its omnipresent religion and use of [[slave]] labor.

The Amarr were the first of the four empires to rediscover space travel. With space travel, they expanded their empire and enslaved less advanced civilizations they encountered. During this time the Amarr enslaved the Matari people. It wasn't until encountering the [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|Gallente]] and Jove that the Amarr expansion came to halt.

Nowadays the Amarr is the largest empire and perhaps the most powerful too. Slavery is still common and the relationships between Amarr and [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|Minmatar]] are poor.

They excel at engagements using [[laser cannon]]s, backed up by [[combat drone (EVE Online)|]]s. Their playstyle prioritizes armor over speed.

h4. External links

* "Official Website: Amarr Empire":https://universe.eveonline.com/empires/amarr
* "EVE University Wiki: Amarr Empire":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Amarr_Empire

title: carthum_conglomerate_(eve_online)
body:
The Carthum Conglomerate is an industrial corporation in the [[Amarr Empire (EVE Online)|]] in [[EVE Online]]. It is mainly known for its [[spacecraft|ships]] that specialize in [[laser cannon]]s and thick armor. Carthum [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s are identifiable by their distinctive red and gold hulls.

The Carthum is a fairly new company that was formed with aid from the [[Caldari State (EVE Online)|Caldari]] [[Lai Dai corporation (EVE Online)|Lai Dai Mega corporation]], which owns a considerable share in the company. Carthum brought much needed vitality into the stale field of research and development and has been responsible for the respectable hi-tech gadgetry in many recent Amarrian space ships.

h4. External links

* "EVE University Wiki: Carthum Conglomerate":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Carthum_Conglomerate

body:

Commonly associated with internal combustion [[engine]]s, pumps, and various [[machinery]], a piston transfers force by converting expanding gas or fluid pressure into mechanical motion—or vice versa.

body:
Caren Hortensia is a character from [i][[Fate/hollow ataraxia]][/i], the daughter of [[Kotomine Kirei]] and [[Claudia Hortensia]].

She has light [[grey hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. 
Usually seen wearing a church [[robe]], and a [[hat]] if she is outdoors. On the other hand, Caren also wears what she calls her 'exorcist uniform' which is composed of a [[dress]], [[pantyhose]], and [[thighhighs]] but without a skirt.

She is introduced as [[caren hortensia (amor caren)|Amor Caren]], a playable Ruler-class Servant, in the 2021 Valentine event of [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: trompe_l'oeil
body:
[b]Trompe l'oeil[/b] (French for "deceives the eye") is a technique in painting and illustration where the artist uses [[perspective]] to create the [[optical illusion|illusion]] that the depicted subject or scene is real, as if the image surface was a window into a three-dimensional space. In it's most pronounced use, a character may appear to climb through this window or interact with the frame or border of the work.

h4. See also

* [[fourth wall]]
* [[through medium]]
** [[through screen]]
** [[through painting]]
** [[through page]]
* [[interactive media]]

title: capcom_vs._snk
body:
A a 2000 head-to-head fighting game produced by [[Capcom]]. It was originally released as an arcade game for Sega's NAOMI hardware and later ported to the Dreamcast. It is the second game in the Capcom vs. SNK series, a video game series that features characters from Capcom and [[SNK]] games. It was followed by [[Capcom vs. SNK 2]] and [[SVC Chaos]].

title: svc_chaos
body:
Otherwise known as [b]SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos[/b] or [b]SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom[/b], this game is a crossover between [[SNK]]'s [[The King of Fighters]], [[Ryuuko no Ken]] (Art of Fighting), [[Fatal Fury]], [[Samurai Spirits]] (Samurai Shodown), [[Athena (series)|]] and [[Metal Slug]] with [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]], [[Warzard]] (Red Earth), [[Darkstalkers]] (Vampire), [[Mega Man (series)|]], and [[Makaimura]] (Ghosts'n Goblins'). The SNK-produced portion of the [[Capcom vs. SNK]] series.

When a player gets hit by one of [[Demitri Maximoff]]'s supers, he will briefly enter a state called "[[Midnight Bliss]]". When the player is defeated by [[Princess Athena]], he will become an animal. On the other hand, when the player is defeated by [[Red Arremer]], he will become a demon.

h4. See also

* [[Akiman pose]]

title: tokido_(gamer)
body:
[b]Tokido[/b] (real name [b]Taniguchi Hajime[/b]) is one of Japan's highest level fighting game players.

He became much more popular over the internet after playing a match of [[street fighter iv (series)|Super Street Fighter IV]] using [[Akuma (street fighter)|Akuma (Gouki)]] against Clark Smith (ClakeyD), an Ibuki user, at the 2010 [[Southern California Regionals]]. 

On the final round of the match, ClakeyD made a huge error which allowed Tokido's Gouki to perform a Focus Attack and finish off ClakeyD's Ibuki with Gouki's Ultra I, the [[shun goku satsu|Shin Shun Goku Satsu (Raging Demon)]]. While the animation for the move was still going Tokido put down his fightstick, walked in front of the projector, and imitated Gouki's pose while the kanji [[Heaven (kanji)|天]] ([i]ten[/i]) was shining on his back, in a ceremony that became known as the "Murder Face".

Three time [[evolution championship series|Evolution]] champion, for [[Capcom vs. SNK 2]] in 2002, [[Street Fighter II (series)|Super Street Fighter II Turbo]] in 2007 and [[Street Fighter V]] in 2017.

title: genryuusai_maki
body:
[b]Genryuusai Maki[/b], more commonly known simply as [b]Maki[/b], is a character in the [[Final Fight]] and [[Street Fighter]] series, who originally appeared in the [[Super Nintendo]] beat 'em up [[Final Fight 2]] as one of the game's main characters. 

Maki is a blond-haired red-clad female ninja who happens to be the younger sister of Guy's fiancee Rena. Like [[Guy (final fight)|]], Maki is also trained in the Bushin style of ninjutsu and uses many of the same abilities and techniques.

Maki was well received by critics and fans alike, becoming one of the most popular Street Fighter characters despite appearing only in [[Capcom vs. SNK 2]] and portable versions of [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Alpha 3]].

title: god_rugal
body: The evil alter-ego of [[Rugal Bernstein]] who only appears in [[Capcom vs. SNK 2]]. God Rugal is a result of Rugal succumbing to [[Akuma (street fighter)|]] or [[Shin Akuma]]'s Satsui no Hadou, mixing it with [[Orochi (kof)|]] power.

title: training_room
body:
A feature of many [[Capcom]] fighting games, such as [[Capcom vs. SNK 2]], [[Marvel vs. Capcom]], [[Street Fighter IV (series)|SFIV]]/[[street fighter v|SFV]], etc.  

It shares some similarity with the Danger Room from [[X-Men]] & expanses seen in [[virtual reality|VR simulations]].

h4. See also

* [[Gym]] [i](an all-purpose facility)[/i]

title: rugal_bernstein
body:
A recurring boss from [[SNK|SNK's]] [[The King of Fighters]]. A wealthy arms dealer, Rugal ran afoul of Goenitz and lost an eye during a battle with him. Impressed by Rugal's ruthlessness, [[Goenitz]] shared a fraction of the Orochi power with him, greatly amplifying his strength. Rugal replaced his right eye with a cybernetic orb, which restored his sight to some degree. 

He hosted the [[The King of Fighters '94|1994 King of Fighters tournament]], serving as the game's final opponent. The battle with Rugal takes place on his private aircraft carrier, the Black Noah. In several games from the series Rugal appears as an enhanced form named [[Omega Rugal]].

* He is the originator of the [[Genocide Cutter]]
* He has two children named [[Adelheid Bernstein|Adelheid]] and [[Rose Bernstein|Rose]].
* In [[Capcom vs. SNK 2]], he gets another alternate form called [[God Rugal]].
* He's often paired up with [[Touhou]]'s [[Yakumo Yukari]] in [[M.U.G.E.N]] and other fan works.
* Artist [[Houtengeki]] does artwork of Touhou's [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] cosplaying as Rugal.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rugal Bernstein":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rugal_Bernstein

title: frank_west
body:
[b]He's covered wars, you know.[/b]

[b]Frank West[/b] is the main character of Capcom's [[Dead Rising 1]] and a co-op player character of [[Dead Rising 2]] CASE:WEST. He also appeared in Ultimate [[Marvel vs. Capcom 3]] and [[Tatsunoko vs. Capcom]]: Ultimate All-Stars. He's a freelance photojournalist renowned for his superhuman sense of survival. 

h4. See also

* Joke tag on pixiv: ジャーナリスト型生物兵器 (Journalist-type Bio-Weapon)

title: tatsunoko_pro
body:
[b]Tatsunoko Production Co., Ltd.[/b] ([b]株式会社竜の子プロダクション[/b] or [b]株式会社タツノコプロダクション[/b]), often shortened to [b]Tatsunoko Pro.[/b] ([b]竜の子プロ[/b] or [b]タツノコプロ[/b]), is a Japanese animation company founded in October 19, 1962  by acclaimed anime pioneer Tatsuo Yoshida along with his brothers Kenji and Toyoharu (Toyoharu adopted the pen name [[Ippei Kuri]]  to distinguish himself from his brothers). 

The studio's name has a double Japanese meaning of "Tatsu's child" (Tatsu being a nickname for Tatsuo) and "seadragon" which was the inspiration for its seahorse corporate logo. Tatsunoko has its headquarters in Kokubunji, Tokyo.

h4. See also

* [[Tatsunoko vs. Capcom]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tatsunoko Production":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tatsunoko_Production

title: shadow_the_hedgehog_(game)
body:
[b][i]Shadow the Hedgehog[/i][/b] (シャドウ・ザ・ヘッジホッグ) is a [[2005]] video game developed by [[Sonic Team]] and published by [[Sega]], released on multi-platform consoles. The story is a continuation of the [[Sonic Adventure]] series, making it one of the only games to do so. In this game, [[Shadow the Hedgehog|Shadow's]] actions are based on the players' choice to either play for good or evil, allowing for branching paths throughout gameplay. It was one of the only [[Sonic (series)|]] games to receive an ESRB rating of [b]E10+[/b], despite Shadow's use of [[profanity]] and semi-realistic weapons.

h4. See also
* [[Sonic Adventure 2]]
* [[Sonic Heroes]] 
* [[Sonic X Shadow Generations]] 

h4. External links

title: tanabata
body:
A Japanese [[festival]] celebrated on July 7 that "celebrates the meeting of the deities [[Orihime (tanabata)|]] and [[Hikoboshi]] (represented by the stars Vega and Altair respectively)". One observed custom during the festival is to write wishes on small slips of paper called [[tanzaku]] and hang them on [[bamboo]]s. On Danbooru, the tanabata tag refers to this custom.

Tanabata originates from the [[Qixi festival]], written the same way. When Qixi made its way to Japan, it quickly got localized and was fused with several other local traditions, notably another folklore about the Tanabata-tsume (棚機津女), hence the reading "Tanabata", and the practice of hanging tanzuku on bamboos. 

Therefore, although written the same way, the terms should not be used interchangeably, Qixi applies strictly to the traditional Chinese version and Tanabata strictly the traditional Japanese version.

h4. See also

* [[Fukinagashi]] - a traditional decorative ball with streamers hung during Tanabata.
* [[Qixi Festival]]
* [[Valentine]]
* [[The Weaver Girl and The Cowherd]] - the original Chinese folklore
* [[Tag group:Holidays and Celebrations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tanabata":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanabata

title: art_fight_attack
body:
A piece of [[gift art]] that was created for the annual Art Fight event.

Art Fight is an annual [[gift art|art gifting]] event that is held each July. Participants are split into two teams that "attack" each other by making gift art of [[original]] characters. At the end of the month, the team with the greater score wins.

title: pokemon_horizons
body:
The eighth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]]. It succeeds [[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys]]. It premiered on April 14, 2023 in Japan with a one-hour special, and on March 7, 2024 in the United States. 

The series features dual protagonists [[Liko (pokemon)|]] and [[Roy (pokemon)|]], who join together with a group of adventurers known as the Rising Volt Tacklers and set out to travel the Pokémon world with them, visiting all the regions introduced in the core series from Kanto to Paldea. Liko also finds herself targeted by the mysterious Explorers organization, which is after her equally mysterious pendant.

One of the protagonists of [[pokemon horizons|Pokémon Horizons]]. She is originally from Cabo Poco in the Paldea region and lived with her parents, [[Lucca (pokemon)|]] and [[Alex (pokemon)|]]. Her grandmother, [[Diana (pokemon horizons)|]], gave her a mysterious pendant, which was a hibernating [[Terapagos|]]. She studies at the Indigo Academy. title: pokemon_journeys
body:
A [[pokemon (Anime)|Pokémon anime]] season announced in 2019 and debuting the same year in Japan.

The official title of the anime in Japan is simply [i]Pocket Monsters[/i], while the international title is [i]Pokemon Journeys: The Series[/i].

Having finally placed at the top of a Pokémon League competition, [[Ash Ketchum]] is one step closer to acheiving his dream of becoming a Pokémon Master. Now he and [[Pikachu]] focus on seeing the world, traveling with their new friend, rookie Trainer [[Goh (pokemon)|]] and his partner, [[Cinderace]], whose goal is to fill his Pokédex and eventually catch the Mythical [[Mew (pokemon)|]]. Can Ash rise through the ranks of the World Coronation Series and meet the Galar Champion and Supreme Monarch [[Leon (pokemon)|]] in the finals?

title: uta_no_prince-sama
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise about male idols by [[broccoli_(company)|Broccoli]], originally starting with an otome game published in 2010 and since then has spawned multiple sequels and rhythm game spin-offs, with the most notable being [[Uta no Prince-sama: Shining Live]]. It has since received a manga and a 2011 anime with a second season in 2012, a third in 2014, a fourth in 2016, and a movie in 2019. 
It is considered one of the foremost franchises in the male [[idol]] genre and has retained its fame both in Japan and worldwide for more than a decade. 

The original plot line followed the heroine [[Nanami Haruka]]’s life in Saotome Academy, a prestigious performing arts school made up of students who are either vying to become an idol or a music producer, as she chases after her dream of becoming a composer and someday writing a song for her favorite idol HAYATO. Haruka becomes acquainted with six of her classmates, who are all competing to become idols. For her project, she must team up with another student as an idol-producer team, and if they are successful, they will join Shining Agency after graduation.  

The franchise features three idol groups: the main group [[STARISH|ST★RISH]], [[QUARTET NIGHT]] - a band made up of the seniors of ST★RISH in the 2013 game [i]Uta no Prince-sama: All Star[/i], and HE★VENS - an anime-only idol group introduced in [[uta no prince-sama maji love 2000%|Uta no Prince-sama: Maji Love 2000%]] and not seen before in the games who become rivals to ST★RISH

title: mao_zedong
body:
The first leader of the [[China|People's Republic of China]] and the Communist Party of China. Partially Unified China after 35 years of civil war and Japanese occupation. 

Infamous for the Great Leap Forward and [[Cultural Revolution]] policies which resulted in tens of millions of Chinese people deaths. Died in the mid 70s right after making peace with the [[united_States|US]], just in time for [[Deng Xiaoping]] to take his place.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mao_Zedong]

A decorated [[cake]] that celebrates one's [[birthday]]. Typically written with the words, "Happy Birthday" followed by the person's name. May include [[candle]](s) to give the person being celebrated a chance to make a wish upon blowing then out.

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: no_humans
body:
No human or human-like characters are visible in the picture.

Human-like characters include [[android]]s and sentient [[humanoid robot]]s, [[traditional youkai]], living [[doll]]s, [[monster girl]]s, [[furry|furries]], and anything else that looks or acts human (i.e. humanoids such as [[Gardevoir]]).

title: johnny_ridden
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. Originated as a mentioned character [[Gundam MSV]], he later becomes a starring character in [[MSV-R: The Return of Johnny Ridden]].

[b]Johnny Ridden[/b] (A.K.A. [b]"The Crimson Lightning"[/b]) is a legendary [[Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] ace pilot from [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. Because of his MS colors (and appearance) he is often mistaken for [[Char Aznable]] (what he hates).

His MS of choice is the [[Zaku II HMT Johnny Ridden Custom]].

body:

title: modakawa_dress
body:
A [[dress]] that went viral in March 2024 from "a tweet":[https://twitter.com/MissAmethysa/status/1765481511753511308] by artist [[MissAmethysa]] which asked:

[quote]which char should i draw wearing this?[/quote]

The dress, popularized by online clothing retailer Modakawa, is listed on their site as the "Sexy Halter Hollow Out Backless Chain Fishtail Lingerie Dress":[https://www.modakawa.com/products/sexy-halter-hollow-out-backless-chain-fishtail-lingerie-dress]. It is a revealing dress featuring a [[halterneck]] held with [[o-ring]]s and an abundance of straps with a [[hip vent]] on each side at the waist. A separate [[gold chain]] adorns it from top to bottom.
 
Many artists began drawing characters wearing the dress, simply referring to it as "the dress."

h4. Examples

* !asset #29047857

h4. See also

* [[meme attire]]

title: multiversus
body:
[b]MultiVersus[/b] is a free-to-play crossover fighting game developed by Player First Games and published by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment. 

Similar to Super Smash Brothers, the game features various characters owned by the Warner Brothers Discovery company including [[Warner Bros.]], [[DC Comics]], HBO, Turner Entertainment, [[Adult Swim]] and [[Cartoon Network]].

On January 31st, 2025, "it was announced":[https://x.com/multiversus/status/1885327981758865568] that Season 5 would be the last update, ending on May 30th, 2025. The game would remain playable offline.

title: nanpa
body:
A Japanese subculture in which fashionable young men hang out in public places to flirt with women passing by.

Japanese media often depicts their flirting attempts as persistent (and even aggressive), refusing to take no for an answer. They are often used as a pretense for a male character to protect his female friend by intimidating them or pretending to be her boyfriend.

title: aris_dance_(meme)
body:
A meme originated from a "video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhS9lPrrLK8] of [[chibi]] [[Aris (blue archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]] dancing made by the artist [[Sechi_(sechihyeo)|]].
* !post #6444361: post #6444361
The music used is "Usagi Flap":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=toPWvdaC84w] (internal OST number 113), which was originally used as the theme of [[RABBIT Platoon (Blue Archive)|RABBIT Squad]].

An official "Blue Archive Taiwan clip":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1YccQTWdO0s] referenced the meme, including a "green screen material":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T9F1Wk8DQdg] of the clip.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Alice Dance":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/alice-dance

title: lion_king_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (Fate)|]], a Lancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wields [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|Rhongomyniad]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|Excalibur]].

This version of Artoria is as she appears in [spoilers]the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity of Fate/Grand Order, who is actually the Goddess Rhongomyniad.[/spoilers] One physical difference from the original is that her eyes are [[empty eyes|lifeless]] and colored bright lime green, with [[bright pupils|glowing pupils]]. A good example of this is post #3835074. She might also sport an [[expressionless]] face, be shown with a white colored cape and in her First Ascension she will have a helmet with white fur. Regular Lancer Artoria uses a red cape and yellow fur.

She can also summon her horse named [[Dun Stallion (fate)|]] and is associated with the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]]. 

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

* !asset #25504938: Helmeted
* !asset #25504937: Helmetless

title: hijikata_toshizou_(dream_portrait)_(fate)
body:
[quote]
Celebrating Fate/Grand Order's 7th Anniversary!

Take a trip down memory lane to mark this momentous occasion.

What would things be like now if that fateful encounter had happened differently?
Maybe we'd be looking at Heroic Spirits in completely new outfits.

Let's take this occasion to look back on the day we first met and imagine "what if..."

title: artoria_pendragon_(fate)
body:
[b]Altria Pendragon[/b] (also known by the popular fan romanization as [b]Artoria Pendragon[/b]) is a character from the [[Fate (series)|]] series, and the [i]de facto[/i] mascot of the series.

She is a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of [[King Arthur (mythology)|]] from the old English mythology, manifested as a "Servant", powerful manifestation of historical/mythological figures in the Fate universe.

She and her variants, with the exception of Arthur Pendragon, are voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

She first appeared in [[Fate/Stay Night]] as [[Saber (fate)|]], but later went on to appear in many other forms throughout the [[Fate (series)|]] series. This tag is an umbrella tag that collects all versions of Artoria Pendragon under one tag.

h4. Variations

title: myrtle_(arknights)
body:
[i]Myrtle, Vanguard of Rhodes Island, is ready to lead the charge into battle![/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Unknown[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]December 13[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Durin[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]131 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A Rhodes Island operator who came from the underground Durin community, being very curious about the outside world. She likes group operations and likes to be where everyone else is. Her appearance and temperament are somewhat childish, but on the battlefield, she displays considerable enthusiasm and knack for command.

Her choice of weapon is a flagpole. Her motif is based on butterflies.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Shimoji Shino]] (Japanese), Gin (Chinese), Hollie Taylor (English), and Chunq Yu-joung (Korean). Her art designer is [[Miebao]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5640791: Default
* !post #5640794: Elite II
* !post #5640798: [[myrtle_(light_gold_celebration)_(arknights)|Light Gold Celebration]]
* !post #6530096: [[myrtle (summer flowers) (arknights)|Summer Flowers]]
* !asset #29039817: [[Myrtle (Bustling Festival) (Arknights)|Bustling Festival]]

title: kaeru_no_tame_ni_kane_wa_naru
body:
A comedic action adventure RPG for the [[Game Boy]], released by [[Nintendo]] in 1992. Rivals Prince of Sablé and Prince Richard are on a race to save the Mille-Feuille Kingdom and its princess Tiramisu from King Delarin, while the kingdom's people are turned into frogs.

The game was not released outside Japan, but it would continue to be referenced in future Nintendo games like [[The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening]] and the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series.

h4. Characters

* [[Prince of Sable]]
* [[Prince Richard (kaeru no tame ni kane wa naru)|]]
* [[Tiramisu-hime]]
* [[Mad Scienstein]]
other_names: カエルの為に鐘は鳴る

title: tiramisu-hime

title: aldnoah.zero
body:
[b]Aldnoah.Zero[/b] (アルドノア・ゼロ [i]Arudonoa Zero[/i]) is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime series created by Olympus Knights and [[A-1 Pictures]], that began July 2014. The director is Ei Aoki and the original creator is listed as Gen Urobuchi.

h4. Synopsis

In 1972, an ancient alien hypergate was discovered on the surface of the moon. Using this technology, humanity began migrating to Mars and settling there. After settlers discovered additional advanced technology, the Vers Empire was founded, which claimed Mars and its secrets for themselves. Later, the Vers Empire declared war on Earth, and in 1999, a battle on the Moon's surface caused the hypergate to explode, shattering the Moon and scattering remnants into a debris belt around the planet. Cut off from Mars, the remnants of the Vers Empire established several massive orbital space stations within the debris belt and a ceasefire was established. 15 years later, in 2014, an attack on the Vers princess during a peace mission causes the Empire to launch a new attack on Earth, this time determined to conquer it once and for all.

h4. Characters

* [[Kaizuka Inaho]]

title: anathema_psykana
body:
The [b]Anathema Psykana[/b], also known as the [b]Sisters of Silence[/b], are an anti-psychic militant order in [[Warhammer 40k]].

They are the militant arm of the Adeptus Astra Telepathica and are internally referred to as the organization's Departmento Investigates. However, their affiliation with this body is largely symbolic, and in truth they are an autonomous military force answering directly to the Emperor and the Lord Commander of the Imperium.

Together with the [[Adeptus Custodes]] they represented the Talons of the Emperor, with the Sisters as the left hand of the Emperor. Fragmenting after the Horus Heresy, they were brought back under Imperial control by [[Roboute Guilliman]] in M42. Their ranks consist entirely of blanks.

title: melody_(projektmelody)
body:
A Canadian [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], starting out as a "Virtual Porntuber" (i.e. a VTuber who specialized on pornographic content) on Chaturbate, becoming popular yet somewhat controversial after becoming the no.1 Chaturbate channel in February 2020. From March 9th on, Melody also began streaming on Twitch.

In November 2020, she became one of the founding members of the Western VTuber talent agency [[VShojo]], after having been her active management for some months prior. She later left the company on July 22, 2025.

Per her lore, she is a futuristic AI program with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[purple hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[blue eyes]].

The titular main character of [i]Eiyou Senshi Carrotman[/i] ("Nutritious Warrior Carrotman"), an in-universe [[tokusatsu]] series beloved by [[Biko Pegasus (umamusume)|]] in [[Umamusume]]. In English, Carrotman's name is rendered as [i]Carrot Ranger[/i].

title: instant_transmission
body:
A [[teleportation]] technique from the [[Dragon Ball]] series. [[Son Goku]] learned the technique during the time he was on planet Yardrat after his battle with [[Frieza]].
For tagging purposes, the identifying detail that sets this apart from generic [[teleportation]] is the accompanying pose: holding the index and middle fingers of one hand to one's forehead.

title: grok_(xai)
body:
A generative artificial intelligence chatbot developed by [[xAI (company)|]].

Based on the large language model (LLM) of the same name, it was launched in November 2023 as an initiative by [[Elon Musk]].

Grok is integrated on the social media platform X, formerly known as [[Twitter]], and has apps for [[apple_inc.|iOS]] and [[android_(os)|Android]].

h4. See Also
* [[Ani (xAI)]]: A character introduced on Grok on July 14, 2025, in a Companions mode to SuperGrok subscribers.
* [[ChatGPT]]
* [[Grok is this true (meme)|]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Grok (chatbot)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grok_(chatbot)
* "Official website":https://grok.com/

title: grok_is_this_true_(meme)
body:
Originates from Twitter users tagging [[grok_(xai)|@Grok]] in any tweet asking the AI to "explain this post" or "is this true". This later becomes a catchphrase mocking these types of users.

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Grok Explain This":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/grok-explain-this
* "Grok Website":https://x.ai/grok

title: adventurer_(ff14)
body:
The Midlander [[Hyur]] who acts as a poster boy for [[Final Fantasy XIV]], also known as the [[Warrior of Light (ff14)|]].

Called many names by fans, whether it be "Hiroshi" by the Japanese (after Director "NQ" Hiroshi Takai), or by English speakers "Meteor" (from Meteor Survivor), "CG Midlander", or even "Derplander" affectionately.

Shown in different Jobs in each installment:

* Final Fantasy XIV 1.0: Gladiator/Archer
* A Realm Reborn: [[Warrior (final fantasy)|]]
* Heavensward: [[Dragoon (final fantasy)|]]
* Stormblood: [[Monk (final fantasy)|]]/[[Samurai (final fantasy)|]]
* Shadowbringers: [[Dark Knight (final fantasy)|]]
* Endwalker: [[Paladin (final fantasy)|]]
* Dawntrail: [[Viper (final fantasy)|]]

For player created adventurers, use [[Warrior of Light (ff14)|]] only.

body:
The 1st [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Suzuki Masaru]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Darkness_Eater/status/1003206962501177344]. It is his former default from June 2018 to April 2021, when it was replaced with his [[Suzuki Masaru (8th Costume)|current default]].

It consists of a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] shirt with a black design on it. He has a [[choker]] with a [[necklace]] and two [[ear piercing|ear piercings]] on his right ear. He wears [[black shorts]] and [[black boots]]. Sometimes, he's shown wearing a long [[black coat]] with a [[fur trim]].

title: happy_meek_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

[[Kiryuin Aoi]]'s trainee. Happy Meek isn't based on any particular racehorse but she seems to be the only genuine and original white horse of the franchise (dominant white is an extremely uncommon color for throughbreds; all the other white-haired horse girls were actually based on gray horses). That being said, she is likely modeled either on Hakutaiyu, Japan's first white horse or on Shirayukihime's several descendants (like Sodashi herself).

Happy Meek is a [[horse girl]] with [[short_hair|short]] [[white hair]] (usually portrayed as an off-white), [[pink eyes]] with a flower hairclip over her left temple and an ornament made out of small flowers around her right ear (although, in her case, this might be irrelevant). 

The player's trainee races against her in the URA Finale.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6264339: [[Tracen School Uniform]] 
* !post #7226193: Racing Outfit

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Happy Meek":[https://umamusume.jp/character/happymeek]
other_names: ハッピーミーク(ウマ娘)

title: circled_9
body:
In the game manual of [[Touhou]]'s [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]], [[Cirno]], pitted as the second player character, was labeled as "⑨" - it stood for バカ ("baka" - "idiot"). Ever since, ⑨ gained notoriety as Cirno's nickname.

Not all [[Cirno]] posts should be tagged [[circled 9]], only posts that incorporate the 9-in-a-circle symbol.

h4. See also

* [[Cirno]]
* [[Team 9 (touhou)|]]
* [[circled 6]]

* [[Nineball|Nine-Ball]] - An [[Armored Core]] [[mecha]] who has the emblem of 9 in a circle.

title: nineball=cirno
body:
A [[fusion]] of [[Cirno]] from [[Touhou]] and [[Nineball]] from [[Armored Core]].

Her name comes from the upgraded version of Nine-ball, [[nineball seraph|Nine-ball=Seraph]]. She is universally depicted as Cirno with Nine-ball's red and black color scheme, and usually the back thrusters of either version of Nine-ball. She is sometimes drawn wielding Nine-ball's weapons and wearing a helmet modeled after Nine-ball's head.

Nineball=Cirno is a result of [[trait connection|the similarities]] between Cirno and Nine-ball: Cirno is the (self-proclaimed) strongest, Nine-ball actually held the status of strongest, and they both have a connection to the number 9.

She may be known by some for the [[M.U.G.E.N]] character based off the idea.

title: kiso_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Kiso (kancolle)|]]. 

In her Kai Ni form, she gains a [[cape]] and a [[cutlass]] as well as a more ornate [[eyepatch]] and four quintuple [[torpedo launcher|torpedo launchers]]. At various places, her ship parts, [[rigging]] and cape are painted to a winter camouflage which resembles a zebra's lines (a reference to her historical Arctic/Aleutian operations in 1943). Getting her damaged reveals that her right eye is yellow instead of green (probably a fake as well).

h4. Skins

* !post #1566666: Kai Ni 
* !post #5810008: [[Kiso (saury festival) (kancolle)|Saury Festival]] - Kai Ni

title: hentaigana
body:
Hentaigana are variant forms of hiragana (one of Japanese's two syllabic writing systems) derived from cursive forms of the Chinese characters that were historically used to write the language ("man'yougana":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man%27y%C5%8Dgana]). While in the past these variant forms could be used interchangeably, they were phased out as part of the 1900 script reform, which was the first of a series of efforts to standardize and modernize Japanese spelling. Hentaigana may be used in modern times for a stylistic or "old-timey" effect.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hentaigana

title: jaguar_e-type
body:
The Jaguar E-Type, or the Jaguar XK-E for the North American market, is a British front mid-engined sports car that was manufactured by Jaguar Cars Ltd from 1961 to 1974. Its sleek appearance, advanced technologies, high performance, and competitive pricing established it as an icon.

title: fushimi_yuzuru
body:
[i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i] character. A second year student and member of [[fine (ensemble stars!)|Fine]]. 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], a [[mole]] under his eye and [[purple eyes]]. At school, he wears the standard [[yumenosaki school uniform|Yumenosaki uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] and [[necktie]]. For Fine, he wears a [[white suit]], a [[bowtie]] with a [[vest]] and [[epaulettes]].

Yuzuru is [[himemiya tori|Tori Himemiya]]'s personal servant since childhood. He's very polite and elegant, but he's always pushed around by Tori's selfishness. With the Himemiya family's aid, he entered the academy partly to serve as Tori's chaperone. He's actually terrible at drawing and he's scared of dogs. 

He transferred around the same time as [[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] and gets along with due to their workaholic tendencies, helping her whenever he can. But he's also jealous that Anzu seems to get along better with Tori than with him.

title: juxtaposition
body:
When the image featuring a photo/video of the character on the screen (phones, TV, computer, etc.), while that character themself is physically present within the same image as well.

Usually, this is done to compare their outward public appearance with their private side, with NSFW works further emphasizing the contrast between the "pure" public appearance and hidden degenerate true self.

h4. Examples

* !post #4796560

h4. See also

title: cart
body:
For tagging purposes a cart is an animal or human driven two or more wheeled vehicle used for carrying loads that is [[pullcart|pulled]] or [[pushcart|pushed]]. They're similar to [[carriage]]s, but  the [[carriage]] tag covers vehicles specifically design for passenger transport, while the cart tag is intended for vehicles designed to transport cargo.

A true cart is an open two-wheeled vehicle for carrying loads that is pulled by animals or humans. For tagging purposes, these should be tagged [[pullcart]] as well. Use [[wagon]] for four-wheeled vehicles designed to transport cargo pulled by animals or humans.

The term "cart" over time has evolved to also refer to a variety of small wheeled vehicles that are pushed or pulled and include vehicles that have more than two wheels.

For the small motor vehicle, see [[go-kart]].

h4. Types of carts

title: admiral_graf_spee_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German pocket battleship/heavy cruiser [i]Admiral Graf Spee[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Ran (Bukeranwu)]], voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[white hair]] with a red highlight and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[black dress]] with a notable [[underboob cutout]], a sewn-on toothy grin, red [[frills]], and [[white_belt|white belts]] crossing over the front. She has a [[red scarf]] with a derivative of the [[nazi war ensign]] on it, [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is very imposing, consisting of two jaw-hulls to her side, 2 triple [[ship turret|turrets]] and 2 quad [[torpedo tubes]]. She has enlargened [[mechanical arms]] with sharp, red finger-claws, that are gloves over her normal hands. She has a mechanical shark-like [[fish tail]], which may be just armor over her normal tail.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2992227: Default
* !post #3522797: [[Admiral Graf Spee (A Novel Anniversary) (Azur Lane)|A Novel Anniversary]] 
* !post #3347966: [[Admiral Graf Spee (Peaceful Daily Life) (Azur Lane)|Peaceful Daily Life]] 
* !post #3672289: [[Admiral Graf Spee (World's Cutest) (Azur Lane)|World's Cutest]] 
* !post #3086316: [[Admiral Graf Spee (Girl's Sunday) (Azur Lane)|Girl's Sunday]] 

h4. Alternative versions 

* !post #5729166: [[Little Spee (azur lane)|]]

title: akagi_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Akagi (kancolle)|Akagi]] obtained her second remodels on the May 21st 2019 (Spring 2019 Event) update, termed Kai Ni and Kai Ni E and shows (along with the Ise-classes' [[Ise Kai Ni (Kancolle)|own]] [[Hyuuga Kai Ni (Kancolle)|remodels]]) how [[Shibafu (glock23)|Shibafu]] has improved.

She keeps the same basic outfit with minor changes. Her skirt is now unambiguously a shortened [[hakama]], her left [[tasuki]] loses its prominent bow, her sleeves gain ribbon trimming, and her [[thighhighs]] are replaced by [[tabi]] with black thighhigh gaiters. Her gear is built up from base with (at Kai Ni) two extra [[quiver|quivers]] on her hips, a black [[flight deck]], a black [[yumi (bow)|yumi]], and more modern AA guns (long 10cm guns). 

In her Kai Ni E remodel, she is dimly lit for night operations, reflecting her new ability to fight in night battles, and her eyes gain a slight glow (although this can be attributed to how the iris interacts with light). Compared to her Kai Ni gear, she replaces her AA gun and her left quiver for a [[sword]]. 

These remodels are essentially hypotheticals, reflecting what she could have been if she hadn't been sunk at Midway. There were plans to modernize Akagi after Midway that would have remedied aiming and firing radius problems with her 120 mm twin mounts by moving them one deck up for cross-deck fire, and ultimately replacing these 120 mm with newer 127 mm dual purpose twin mounts.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3513705: Kai Ni (armored)
* !post #3514266: Kai Ni E (night)

title: katagiri_nanana
body:
A character in [[Tokimeki Idol]]. A one-of-a-kind girl with an unique sensibility, who is happy as long as she can have songs and her guitar. Her use of mysterious phrases and first-person English such as "I am" and tone are influenced by her favorite teacher, a legendary singer called "Echigo Schubert," who she looks up to as her "spiritual master." She is free-spirited and not good at group activities.

Nanana is a girl with a long bluish gray hair with a bun behind and has bluish gray eyes. She is of an slightly curvy build and average height. She wears a black wrist accessory and the high school first year uniform, which is a light blue shirt, beige dress, brown belt, a black thigh high with a gray and white line with traditional black school shoes.

In her [[Abigail Williams (Swimsuit Foreigner) (First Ascension) (Fate)|first ascension]], it appears as a black bumpy-skinned creature with an orange flared opening on its head. title: adidas
body:
A major German [[sportswear|sports apparel]] manufacturer. Besides sports [[shoes|footwear]], the company also produces other products such as bags, shirts, and other sports and clothing related goods. The company is the largest sportswear manufacturer in Europe and the second largest sportswear manufacturer in the world.

The company's clothing and shoe designs typically feature three parallel bars.

Sub-brands of Adidas include [[Yeezy (brand)|]] and [[Y-3 (brand)|]].

title: tekken_6
body: Tekken 6 is a fighting game developed and published by [[Bandai Namco|Bandai Namco Games]]. It is the seventh main installment in the [[Tekken]] franchise. It was released in Japanese arcades on November 26, 2007 as the first game running on the [[PlayStation 3]]-based System 357 arcade board. It is also the first Tekken game to be released on a non-Sony console, the [[Xbox 360]].

title: guncannon
body:
A fire support [[mobile suit]] in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] universe first deployed in UC 0079. Main armament includes two 240mm [[shoulder cannon]]s, two 60mm vulcan cannons mounted on the head, and a [[beam rifle]] as a sidearm.

Unit Designation: [b]RX-77 Guncannon[/b] (the particular subtype that appeared in the show is [b]RX-77-2[/b])

In the compilation movie trilogy, after the [[Guntank]] was decommissioned at Jaburo, a second [[Guncannon]] is introduced. To differentiate it from the original Guncannon, both Guncannons receive numbered codenames, marked on the left chest, left shin, and right foot (those being C-108 and C-109).

Its shoulder cannons are sometimes parodied by other characters with similar equipment, such as [[Blastoise]] from [[Pokemon]], [[Yasaka Kanako]] from [[Touhou]], and [[Shigure (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]].

It was designed by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]].

title: team_rocket
body:
A crime syndicate in the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] franchise, most notably appeared as a recurring antagonist in the [[pokemon (anime)|the anime adaptation]].

Their uniforms are black with a red "R" on the chest, and topped with a flat cap eye mask. Exception comes in the frequent Rocket team in the anime, which have white clothes with no extra accessories.

This tag should only apply to group pictures of Team Rocket members or pictures directly referencing the organization, logos, [[Team Rocket Uniform]], ect. This tag should not apply to solo members of the group out of uniform.

h4. Notable members

h5. Introduced in the games

* [[Giovanni (pokemon)|]] (leader)
* [[Archer (pokemon)|]], [[Ariana (pokemon)|]], [[Petrel (pokemon)|]], & [[Proton (pokemon)|]] (executives)
* [[Team Rocket Grunt]]s

h5. Introduced in the anime

* [[Jessie (pokemon)|]], [[James (pokemon)|]], & [[Meowth]] (Every series prior to [[pokemon horizons|Horizons]])

title: long_island_rail_road
body:
The Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) is a railroad in the southeastern part of the U.S. state of New York, stretching from Manhattan to the eastern tip of Suffolk County on Long Island. The railroad currently operates a public commuter rail service, with its freight operations contracted to the New York and Atlantic Railway

The LIRR is publicly owned by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA). which refers to it as MTA Long Island Rail Road. 

H4. Logo
* !asset #28932257: MTA Long Island Rail Road
* !asset #28932552: LIRR Keystone Logo

H4. Rolling stock
* !asset #28933102: [[EMD DM30AC]] Dual mode [[electric locomotive|Third rail electric]]-[[Diesel locomotive|Diesel]] [[locomotive]] 
* !asset #28934246: Budd M3 [[Multiple unit train|Electric Multiple Unit]] 
* !asset #28934645: Bombardier M7 [[Multiple unit train|Electric Multiple Unit]]
* !asset #28935178: Kawasaki Heavy Industries M9  [[Multiple unit train|Electric Multiple Unit]]

title: diesel_locomotive
body:
A [[diesel locomotive]] is a type of [[locomotive]] in which the power source is a diesel engine. Several types of diesel locomotives have been developed, differing mainly in the means by which mechanical power is conveyed to the driving wheels. The most common are diesel-electric locomotives and diesel-hydraulic.

H4. Examples

* !asset #23120876: Diesel-Mechanical Locomotives: How it works
* !asset #23120887: Diesel-Hydraulic Locomotives: How it works
* !asset #23142653: GE C44-9W: "Comfort Cab" Cab design Example 
* !asset #23143629: EMD SW1500: A Diesel Shunter/Switcher
* !asset #23120898: BR Class 03: a Diesel Shunter/Switcher with a connecting rod

* !post #7238153: China Railways DF4
* !asset #23120985: [[Japan Railways|JR]] [[ Class DD51 ]]
* !asset #23136609: EMD E5A: "Bulldog Nose" Design Example
* !post #8002542: [[EMD SD40-2]]: Short Hood "Hood Unit" Example 
* !asset #23137031: EMD GP30: High Hood "Hood Unit" Example

title: emd_sd40-2
body:
A Dash 2 Version of the SD40.

A 6-axle, 3,000 horsepower (2,240 kilowatt) [[Diesel Locomotive| Diesel]] [[locomotive]] developed by [[General Motors]]' Electro-Motive Division ([[General motors|GM]] EMD) for the North American market in the early 1970s, the SD40-2 is one of the company's most successful products. Nearly 4,000 units would be produced for North American railroads across a 17-year period.

H4. See Also
* [[Locomotive]] 
** [[Diesel locomotive]]
* [[Train]]

title: vienna_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Originally started out as a facecam streamer, she debuted her vtuber model on May 17, 2021. The model is illustrated by [[hayamafair]] and [[Live2D|L2D]] rigged by [[Brian Tsui (artist)|]].

Previously a member of [[Cloud9]] as a [[League of Legends]] content creator, she left the team after two years on February 23, 2023. She afterwards switched to [[Sonii (odyssey interactive)|]], acting as PR for Odyssey Interactive. After her internship contract ended, she came back as Vienna.

She is a [[dragon girl]] with [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]], as well a small set of [[dragon horns]]. She has a [[dragon tail]] as well, but it is not visible in all of her appearances.

h4. Costumes

* !post #5370145: [[Vienna (vtuber) (1st costume)|Default]]

title: koyama_yuzu
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Driver of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.. Also Vice President of the student council.

Her name is based on the citrus fruit [[yuzu (fruit)|yuzu]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Takahashi Mikako]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

The gentle Vice President of the Student Council. It feels like she's being manipulated quite a bit by the President and Kawashima. Everyone admires her big boobs. Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1283992[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Team Turtle's driver. Former Student Council Vice President. A competent right-hand, she fills in on the management of the Student Council for Anzu who usually does nothing. With a suprising aptitude for maneuvering tanks, in the Pravda battle of the 63rd Tournament she outmaneuvered a large amount of T-34 tanks, helping to destroy their enemies with point-blank firings.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

The (former) Vice-president who supports Anzu. Has a gentle personality and is often bossed around by Anzu, who starts things on a whim, and Momo, who is like an instant water heater. Nevertheless, she is an indisputable member of the student council, dealing with intruders from other schools and handling various practical matters.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]
