title: kawashima_momo
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Gunner and loader of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. Also the Public Relations Manager of the student council. Is made the overall commander for [i]Das Finale[/i].

Her name means [[peach]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Ueda Kana]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

Runs public relations for the Ooarai Girls Academy student council. Supports the shenanigans of the president. Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1291295[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Is Team Turtle's loader, gunner, and radio operator. Despite her constant condescending attitude, she's actually weak in a pinch and will panic right away. Faithful to the President, during the crisis of the second school closing, she was viewed as conducting herself in an admirable way as a substitute for the President.  Although in charge of the gunnery, her aim is shockingly terrible.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

The (former) public affairs officer, she runs around freely and is commonly known as the "one-eyed strategist". She is also affectionately known as "Momo-chan-senpai". However, due to her nagging personality and the occasional clumsy behavior that she shows, her kouhai don't seem to listen to her that much.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: kadotani_anzu
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander, radio operator, occasional gunner, and leader of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. Also the President of the student council.

Her name means [[apricot]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Fukuen Misato]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

President of the Ooarai Girls Academy student council. She's short, but is generally lighthearted about it. She's the perpetrator in drawing Miho into Tankery.  Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1283992[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Boards the Hetzer (38(t)) as the tank commander. Former Student Council President. Used an overbearing method to draw Miho back into Tankery after she had transferred schools to distance herself from it. Although somewhat coercive in her doings, she cares about the school more than anything else. Likes dried potatoes.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

h6. Operation More Love Love

One who loves dried potatoes, she's the (former) student council president who leads Ooarai Girls. Her fearless behavior continues to amaze those around her. Although she appears cool-natured, she's actually affectionate towards her kouhai and friends, especially to the short-tempered Momo.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: prinz_eugen_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the third [i]Admiral Hipper[/i]-class heavy cruiser in [[Kantai Collection]]. Designed by [[Shimada Fumikane]]. Voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] tied with [[anchor_hair_ornament|anchor hair ornaments]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] similar to [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]]'s. Unlike the other Kriegsmarine girls in the game however, her uniform is not bottomless. Instead she wears a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt|black]] [[microskirt]]. She also wears short [[black thighighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs]] that barely reach above her knees.

In her remodel, her uniform gains a [[camouflage]] pattern, her [[skirt]] turns [[white skirt|white]], and her turrets turn blue.

title: yamagumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yamagumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]] tied into a [[single braid]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Fujikawa-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[green bowtie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[bike shorts]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], [[depth charge]]s dangling from her left suspender, and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her right leg [[thigh strap]].

body:

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent pin]] on the sailor collar, [[white necktie]], [[black skirt]], plain [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, canisters/[[depth charge]]s strapped to her [[brown belt]], a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles.

She has [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[white hair|silvery white]] hair with a single prominent [[red streaks|red streak]] in the front. She also has [[yellow eyes]] and [[demon horns|demon-like horns]].

title: matori_(pokemon)
body:
A supporting character in the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]]. She is a member of [[Team Rocket]], and [[Giovanni (pokemon)|]]'s secretary.

She was initially a minor character, debuting in the final episode of the [[pokemon dppt (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Diamond & Pearl]], and making several small appearances in the following two series. In [[pokemon sm (anime)|Pokémon the Series: Sun & Moon]], she gains a more significant role, becoming a rival figure for [[Jessie (pokemon)|]], and heading a special Team Rocket unit named the [b]Matori Matrix[/b].

h4. Pokémon

h4. See also

body:
[[Socks]] or stockings that end just above the knee. In comparison to regular [[thighhighs]], they are shorter and leave a larger gap between the legwear and the [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in cases of [[zettai ryouiki]].

Judge length based on the distance from the top of the legwear and the knee, not the size of the gap. Combinations of certain clothing with full thighhighs can also produce a sizable area of exposed skin.

See post #86570 for reference, read the translation notes.

title: radiation_symbol
body:
h4. ☢

A symbol used to warn people of the presence of [[radioactive|radiation]]. This symbol is usually seen on containers used to store or transport radioactive substances.
A typical public place where you might see this symbol is outside an [[X-ray]] room at a hospital.
It is a trefoil around a small inner circle.

On Danbooru, most commonly associated with [[Reiuji Utsuho]], for her ability to manipulate nuclear fission.

h4.See Also

title: dr._eggman
body:
The evil scientific genius known as Dr. Ivo "Eggman" Robotnik is the long-time nemesis of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]]. He's got the master plan, devising many schemes in attempts to destroy Sonic and conquer the world, but he fails 99% of the time; though he's very unpredictable.

He is [[Gerald Robotnik]]'s grandson, and [[Maria Robotnik]]'s cousin, and is also said to possess an IQ of 300.

Voiced in Japanese by [[Ohtsuka Chikao]] (before 2013), Takiguchi Junpei (OVA only) and Nakamura Koutarou currently. Dubbed in English by Deem Bristow (before 2005) and Mike Pollock currently. As Dr. Robotnik, he has been voiced by Long John Baldry, Jim Cummings, and Garry Chalk. [[Jim Carrey]] portrays him in the live-action film franchise.

title: menacing_(jojo)
body:
"Menacing", or ゴゴゴゴ (gogogogo), is a sound effect used in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], commonly used in the presence of dangerous or intimidating characters or objects. It is an example of [i]gitaigo[/i] or "phenomime", a sound effect that represents a mood or feeling rather than an actual sound.

The tag name comes from the fact the official subtitles for the anime, provided by Crunchyroll, will often translate the text, as it appears on screen, as "Menacing".

h4. See also
* [[dodododo]]

title: batman
body:
A superhero from [[DC Comics]] and the titular main hero of the [[Batman (series)|]] franchise.

His real name is [[Bruce Wayne]], a wealthy man who witnessed his parents' murders and vowed to fight crime in Gotham City. He dons a black [[superhero costume]] and bat-themed mask, and utilizes gadgets and martial arts rather than superpowers like traditional superheroes. Also known as [[the Dark Knight]].

In many crossover media, Batman is frequently depicted as a rival of [[Superman]], primarily due to their contrasting qualities such as Superman's usage of superhuman power compared to Batman's usage of gadgets and their clashing philosophies regarding how to handle a villain.

He was created by the late Bob Kane and the late Bill Finger and debuted in [i]Detective Comics[/i] #27 (1939).

* [[Ougon Bat]]

title: clive_(pokemon)
body:
A supporting character from [[pokemon_sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]. He is a student from the Naranja (S)/Uva (V) Academy who serves as backup for the player throughout the story's Operation Starfall. He wears the respective Academy's [[naranja_academy_school_uniform|school]] [[uva_academy_school_uniform|uniform]] and styles his hair as a [[pompadour]].

In reality, Clive is an alter-ego used by Director [[Clavell (pokemon)|]] to come closer to [[Team Star]] and understand their motivations.

title: silver_(pokemon)
body:
A recurring character in the [[Pokemon]] series.

While he generally retains the same appearance and role (a boy with [[red eyes]] and [[red hair]] who often wears a [[black shirt]], and being the son of the notorious [[Giovanni (pokemon)|]]), he has several incarnations with different backstory.

In [[Pokemon GSC]] and [[Pokemon HGSS|HGSS]], he is a rival of the player character. In [[Pokemon Adventures]], he is an anti-hero protagonist in the [i]GSC chapter[/i] and the [i]HGSS chapter[/i]. Initially, he is a mysterious thief.

No definitive name is given for him in the core series. His default name is [b]Silver[/b] in [i]Pokémon Gold[/i] and [i]Pokémon Crystal[/i], [b]Gold[/b] in [i]Pokémon Silver[/i], [b]Soul[/b] in [i]Pokémon HeartGold[/i], and [b]Heart[/b] in [i]Pokémon SoulSilver[/i]. He is sometimes called [b]Kamon[/b] by fans.

title: ethan_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Ethan[/b], known as [b]Hibiki[/b] (ヒビキ) in Japan, is the male player character in [[pokemon gsc|Pokemon Gold and Silver]].

A reliable veteran Pokémon Trainer from Johto, this energetic nature lover can often be found roaming the mountains.

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. In his [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, he wears a [[backwards hat|backwards-]][[baseball cap|cap]], a [[black shirt]] under a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[red jacket|jacket]] with a [[zipper pull tab|zip tab]], a [[pokegear|Pokégear]], [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]], and carries a [[grey bag|grey]] [[backpack]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Gold[/b] who has [[yellow eyes|gold eyes]] and often carries a billiard [[cue stick]].

title: princess_connect!
body:
Princess Connect! is a web browser game created by [[Cygames]] which closed in late 2015. In August 2016, [i]Princess Connect! Re:Dive[/i] was announced as a remake of the original game and advertised as an Anime RPG.

In February 2018, the game was officially released for Android and iOS. The remake is notable for using an anime-style format to tell its story complete with an "opening song":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hq8uuBB7SoM], "cutscenes":[https://youtu.be/xCX1Qx40sUM?t=447], "ending credits":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XXC4TSTuxU], and even a next "episode preview":[https://youtu.be/xCX1Qx40sUM?t=739]. Wit Studio is credited for the anime portions of the game. A global version was released on January 19, 2021, and later "ended":[https://www.crunchyroll.com/news/latest/2023/3/30/an-important-update-regarding-princess-connect-re-dive] on April 30, 2023.

The gameplay in the remake is heavily reliant on team composition to progress through the more difficult portions of the game and encourages raising multiple characters to complete certain challenges. Despite differing initial rarities, all characters can be raised to the maximum rarity which unlocks their full stories and maximum potential.

In the original story, the game was set in "Legend of Astrum", an MMO where the player would meet various girls and recruit them. Because of the MMO setting, each girl had a fantasy version and a real-life version. The story in the remake plays out as a sequel, starting the narrative with a "Bad End" to the original series in which the characters remain in the MMO, unaware of there ever being a separate real world.

h4. Characters

h6. Player

* [[Yuuki_(princess_connect!)|]]

h6. [[Gourmet Guild (princess connect!)|]]

The main guild in Re:Dive.

* [[Pecorine (princess connect!)|]]

* [[Kokkoro (princess_connect!)|]] 
* [[Sheffy (princess connect!)|]] (from Act 2 onwards)

h6. [[Twinkle Wish (princess connect!)|]]

The main guild in the original game.

* [[Yui (princess connect!)|]]
* [[Rei (princess connect!)|]]
* [[Hiyori (princess connect!)|]]

title: mirai_akari
body:
[[Virtual YouTuber]]. A cheery, social girl who was one of the [[virtual youtuber shiten'nou|first large Virtual YouTubers]] after [[Kizuna Ai]]. Slightly pervy. She was originally managed by [[Eilene]] until mid-2018, belonged to [[ENTUM]] until it shut down at the end of 2019, and joined GOOM STUDIO afterward in late 2020. After more than five years, she announced she was "retiring":https://twitter.com/MiraiAkari_prj/status/1639190621373231106/photo/1 at the end of March 2023, due to creative differences with her management, among other things.

[spoiler]The "Former Shiten'nou" would reincarnate under [[Sony Music Virtual]] as [[Aglio Olio e Peperoncino]], though initially this connection would not be shown explicitly until "later":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=doVCVgN9O9E&t=1132s].[/spoiler]

title: cave_story
body:
An indie side-scrolling platformer game created by a Japanese artist and programmer known as Pixel ([[Amaya Daisuke]]).

Notable for its single-handed creation, its unique story, and innovative yet nostalgic gameplay. It was produced for Windows; an independent team of translators offered a localization in English, titled [i]Cave Story[/i]. 

The player controls an amnesiac robot named [[Quote (cave story)|]] who decides to help a resistance effort by the rabbit-like [[Mimiga]] and their human compatriots, a team of scientists. The team's doctor came across a powerful artifact called the Demon Crown, granting him the power of a sealed evil, and the allegiance of [[Misery (cave story)|]], the crown's creator, and her associate [[Balrog (cave story)|]]. 

The game was officially released in English as a [[Wii]] WiiWare game. While it costs 1200 Nintendo Points, the WiiWare version came with several modes the original did not possess, such as the ability to play as fan-favorite, [[Curly Brace]]. This version was later sold as [[Nintendo DSi|DSiWare]] as well. 

It has gotten a full-scale remake on the [[Nintendo 3DS]].

h4. Characters

* [[Balrog (cave story)|]]
* [[Curly Brace]]
* [[Date Fuyuhiko]]
* [[King (cave story)|]]

title: balrog_(cave_story)
body:
Balrog is a character in [[Cave Story]]. He is a typical "idiotic recurring villain" in that you fight him multiple times, he isn't actually very evil, and he's completely ineffective as a villain either way. He often accompanies [[Misery (cave story)|]] as she does [[Date Fuyuhiko|The Doctor]]'s bidding.

His peculiar, rectangular-shaped body made fans think he was [[toaster]] or a [[lunchbox]], though it was later confirmed his design was based off of a [[bar soap|bar of soap]].

[spoiler]
In the game's best ending, Balrog swoops in after the destruction of the Demon Crown to save Quote and Curly. The three of them decide to live together after the ending.
[/spoiler]

title: curly_brace
body:
Heroine of [[Cave Story]]. Following her own stranding and subsequent amnesia, she takes a pack of [[mimiga]] children under her ward. With her trusty machine gun, and the aid of [[Quote (cave story)|]], she vows to protect them at all costs, contrary to her original mission...

She has [[blue eyes]], [[white skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], and [[robot ears]]. She wears a [[red tank top|red]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[tank top]] that exposes [[midriff]], and [[red pants]]. She is often depicted wearing or holding [[green panties]] in reference to a secret easter egg.

title: quote_(cave_story)
body: The mostly-nameless protagonist of [[Cave Story]]. His name is unidentified at first. He befriends [[Curly Brace]] and helps a team of human scientists rescue the [[mimiga]]s from The Doctor.

title: sakamoto_sue
body:
One of the protagonists of [[cave story|Doukutsu Monogatari/Cave Story]].  A spirited [[Mimiga]] distinguished by her blue/purple shirt and the [[scar]] on the bridge of her nose.

[spoiler]Towards the end of the game, she is transformed into a more adult-proportioned form something like a hybrid between a Mimiga and a human, with [[dark_skin|dark skin]], [[white_fur|white fur]], and either [[rabbit ears|rabbit ears]] or hair in the shape thereof.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She is actually a human child who was turned into a Mimiga by [[Misery (cave story)|]].  During the end credits, her original form is seen to be a girl with [[green_hair|green hair]] styled in [[twintails]].[/spoiler]

title: misery_(cave_story)
body:

She has [[red eyes]], [[white skin]], and [[blue hair]] (green in the original). She wears a [[green tank top|green]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[tank top]] that exposes [[midriff]], and [[green pants]]. Her [[earrings]] change color depending on what version she appears in.

title: gyaruo
body:
The male counterpart to [[gyaru]]. While the term originated from the styles reported on by fashion magazine [i]Men's Egg[/i], it has since gone on to become a moniker for the youth subculture that wore it.

Like their female counterparts, typical gyaruo attire comes in different flavors. The most common depictions have [[tan]]s or [[dark skin]], [[blonde hair]] with or without an [[undercut]], or some sort of loose fashion. However, not everyone who is tan or blond may be part of the gyaruo subculture.

Also spelled as "gyaru-oh" or "gal-o":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1EKTw50Uf8M] alternately. Due to their flashiness, 2010s japanese youth tend to associate them with the term "charao" (チャラ男).

As with their female counterpart, gyaruo were similary depicted as either an extroverted and often hot-headed douchebag in mainstream, or being a hypersexual who hits on many different women in erotic works.

A [[trap]] who dresses up as a [[gyaru]] does not count as a gyaruo.

h4. Examples
* !post #9158423
* !post #5191916
* !post #8215361

h4. See also
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: shocker_(gesture)
body:
A hand gesture in which the ring finger is held down while the other fingers are extended.

The shocker is known colloquially as "two in the pink, one in the stink." This refers to the act of fingering the vagina and anus at the same time, hence the "shock".

title: prithvi_mudra
body:
Prithvi Mudra, or the gesture of earth, is a hand gesture where both the ring finger and thumb touch, but the remaining three fingers are out. Unlike [[shocker (gesture)]], this is a more general gesture without sexual connotations. 

The prithvi mudra is a grounding mudra used in yoga to stabilize the self and prevent wrist cramps, but contains Indian roots and is sometimes seen on deity statues. It can be used by anyone.

title: help:community_rules
body:
These Community Rules govern all social interactions between Danbooru users, including on the forum, in the comments, in private messages, and off-site in the Discord and on Github.

h4. General Rules

* Be friendly to other users.
* Don't insult, attack, abuse, threaten, or harass other users.
* Don't engage in hate speech, use racist or sexist slurs, or engage in other hateful conduct.
* Don't send spam.

h6. Account Rules

* Don't create multiple accounts to evade bans or to bypass account restrictions or limitations.
* Don't make usernames that insult, harass, or impersonate other users, or that use slurs, hate speech, or other derogatory language.
* Don't trade or share your account to others.

h6. Comment Rules

* Write comments in English. Other languages may be used if it's relevant to the post at hand, but in general, Danbooru is an English speaking website.
* Don't post unmarked spoilers. Use [code][spoiler][/spoiler][/code] tags to mark spoilers.
* Don't delete and repost comments to avoid downvotes.
* Don't abuse the voting system. Don't create multiple accounts to vote multiple times. Don't use bots or scripts to vote automatically. Don't mass downvote a user's comments to harass them.

h6. Forum Rules

* Don't use the forum for topics unrelated to Danbooru.
* Be civil to other users. Don't start flame wars because you disagree with someone.
* Be welcoming to new users. Don't be rude to new users because they posted in the wrong thread, asked a question in the wrong place, or asked a question that has already been answered.

h6. DMail Rules

* Don't use DMails to harass other users.
* Don't use DMails to trade or share content that is illegal or against Danbooru's rules.

h6. Post Rules

* Don't use flags to harass or target other uploaders.
* Don't flag posts if they don't break the [[help:upload_rules|upload rules]].
* Don't abuse the voting system. Don't create multiple accounts to vote multiple times. Don't use bots or scripts to vote automatically. Don't mass downvote a user's uploads to harass them.
* Don't engage in edit wars over tags. If there is disagreement over how a post should be tagged, bring it to the forum.

h6. User Feedback Rules

* Be civil when writing feedbacks. Don't insult or demean other users in feedbacks.
* Don't use the feedback system to attack or harass other users. Don't use feedbacks as a weapon to get users unfairly banned.

h6. Discord Rules

* Don't attack, insult, or talk negatively about other users, including Danbooru users not in the Discord.
* Don't post loli, shota, gore, bestiality, or any other content that is against Discord's terms of service.
* Take important discussions to the forum so that all users may participate.
* Obey the other rules listed in the #rules channel.

h4. See also

* [[help:upload rules]]
* "Terms of Service":/terms_of_service

Masturbation is the act of stimulating one's own erogenous zones (most notably the [[pussy|vulva]] —including the [[clitoris]]/[[labia]]/vaginal-opening— in females, the [[penis]] in males, and the [[nipples]] of both genders) with the aim of sexual self-gratification, whether alone or in the company of others. Masturbation need not conclude in [[orgasm]].

This tag is typically not used when the masturbation in question is part of another sex act, such as [[bukkake]] (see forum #79127).

Other [[tag group:sex objects|sex objects]] may be used (usually by women), such as [[vibrator|vibrators]], [[dildo|dildos]], etc. Men sometimes use [[artificial vagina|artificial vaginas]] or other sex toys, as well. title: toei_company
body:
A major Japanese entertainment company, founded on October 1, 1949 as Tokyo Eiga, distributing the films of Taisei Eiga (1947) and Toyoko Eiga (1938), who merged together with it on April 1, 1951 to become Toei Company, Ltd.

Originally known for [[jidaigeki]] and [[yakuza]] films, it would garner attention for its animated and live-action television content, the former handled by film and animation subsidiary Toei Animation (founded on January 23, 1943 and acquired in 1956), and the latter handled by Toei TV Production (founded on November 2, 1959), which is known today for its [[tokusatsu]] output.

Toei Animation produced the first anime titles such as [[Mahou Tsukai Sally]] and [[Mazinger Z]] from which today's standards were set. Other popular series that Toei produced/is producing include [[Hokuto no Ken]], [[Precure]], [[Dragon Ball]], [[One Piece]], [[Digimon]] and the first [[Yu-Gi-Oh! (toei)|]] anime. Toei TV Production meanwhile would produce [[Kamen Rider]], [[Super Sentai]], and [[Metal Hero]], among other tokusatsu franchises.

Toei won the Animage Anime Grand Prix award for [[Ginga Tetsudou 999]] in 1981, [[Saint Seiya]] in 1987 and [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] in 1992. 

h4. See also

* [[TV Asahi]]
* [[Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters]] (formerly Toei Flyers)

title: shiranui_mai
body:
A Japanese fire-wielding [[ninja]] from [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and later [[The King of Fighters]]. She debuted in [i][[Fatal Fury 2]][/i].

Her trademarks are her [[folding fan]], and her [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[Japanese clothes]] that show off her [[large breasts]], legs, and overall physique. She has [[brown eyes]] and most commonly wears her [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied up with an ornamental hairpin, usually referred to as a [[motoyui]].

Mai is the last native heir to Shiranui-ryuu Ninjutsu, with a particular skill in fire ninja magic. She has a loving infatuation with - and at least as of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], is engaged to - fellow Shiranui-ryuu practitioner [[Andy Bogard]], whom she trained with at a relatively young age and she came to see as a good man (though she tended to move the relationship a little too quickly for Andy's liking). As of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], she and Andy both train a young Shiranui-ryuu disciple named [[Hokutomaru]]. She is good friends with most of the rest of the Fatal Fury roster, not least of which includes Andy's brother [[Terry Bogard|Terry]] and best friend [[Joe Higashi]]. In The King of Fighters, she is a founding member of the Women Fighters Team alongside [[King (SNK)|]] and [[Yuri Sakazaki]].

Mai is one of SNK's most popular characters, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions. Her oldest and arguably greatest cross-company [[rivalry|rival]] is [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter|Street Fighter's]] [[Chun-Li]]. She notably appears as a guest character in both [[Dead or Alive]] ([i]DOA 5 Last Round[/i] and [i]DOA 6[/i]) and [[Street Fighter 6]], being the second ever guest character (after [[Terry Bogard|Terry]]) to appear in a mainline Street Fighter title.

Due to her revealing attire, she was allegedly denied a cameo in [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]], since she would be challenging the game's [[CERO]] rating of A; the way Sakurai put it in the announcement ("[[Smash is for good boys and girls]]") was turned into a meme. She received a new outfit with her appearance in Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves. The [[tank top]] and [[short shorts]]/[[dolphin shorts]] casualwear/nightwear she wore in her [[SNK Heroines: Tag Team Frenzy|SNK Heroines]] ending, previously referenced in her and Andy's Real Bout Fatal Fury 2 endings, makes a cameo appearance as part of her character select animation in Street Fighter 6.

h4. Appearance

title: outrage_mk_ii
body: [[Sol Badguy]]'s new sword in the latest [[Guilty Gear]] installment, [[guilty_gear_strive|Strive]]. A more complete version of the [[junkyard dog mk iii]], and given the same name of the Japanese thrash metal band who’s lead singer performs vocal tracks for the Guilty Gear series.

title: t-34_(movie)
body:
2019 Russian war movie about the crew of the [[World War II]] [[T-34]] [[tank]].

In the West the movie is famous for its ridiculous trailer, where the crew of T-34 shoots over the hill and hits the German [[Panther (tank)|Panther tank]] in the turret roof at near zero degrees, after which its commander says "[[profanity|Scheiße]]" and the tank explodes several seconds after the hit.

h4. External links

* "Trailer":https://youtu.be/1Sj4pEm7FkU
* "IMDB":https://imdb.com/title/tt8820590/

title: spoon
body:
A piece of cutlery that has a rounded end to assist in eating liquid or non-solid foods such as [[cereal]], [[soup]], and porridge. It's also used for stirring one ingredient into another, or mixing together a flavoring/sweetener into one's beverage.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: yumizuka_satsuki
body:
A character that appears in [[Tsukihime]] and [[Melty Blood]]. She is [[Tohno Shiki]]'s classmate who after an incident develops an unrequited one-sided crush on him, but in return he doesn't notice her much and just sees her as another classmate. [spoilers] She tragically turns into a [[vampire]].[/spoilers]

Usually portrayed as a girl in [[school uniform]] with a [[two side up]] hairstyle and [[red eyes]].

title: mystic_eyes
body:
A type of [[magic]] featured in [[TYPE-MOON]] works. This tag applies when they're visibly seen in use, usually identified by [[alternate eye color]]s, [[glowing eyes]], and/or [[eye trail]]s.

h4. Known Mystic Eyes
* Clairvoyance: [[Viy (fate)|]]
* Compulsion: [[Hephaestion (fate)|]]
* [[Mystic Eyes of Death Perception|Death Perception]]: [[Ryougi Shiki]], [[Tohno Shiki]], [[Tepeu (fate)|]]
* Distortion: [[Asagami Fujino]]
* [[Mystic Eyes of Enchantment|Enchantment]]: [[Arcueid Brunestud]], [[Nrvnqsr Chaos]], [[Kuonji Alice]], [[Aozaki Touko]]
* Heavenly Eye: [[Miyamoto Musashi (fate)|]]
* Petrification (Cybele): [[Medusa (fate)|]]
* Precognition: [[Seo Shizune]], [[Seo Akira]], [[Kamekura Mitsuru]]
* Prolongation: [[Ophelia Phamrsolone]]
* [[Mystic Eyes of roses|Roses]]: [[Dead Apostle Noel (tsukihime)|]]

* Unnamed: [[Reines El-Melloi Archisorte]], [[Tohno Shiki (2)]] / [[Michael Roa Valdamjong]] 

h4. See Also
* https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Mystic_Eyes

title: asuka_shin_(ultraman_dyna)
body:
The main protagonist of [[ultraman_dyna_(series)|Ultraman Dyna]]. He is also [[Ultraman Dyna]]'s human host, as well as a member of Super GUTS. 

Not to be confused with another character with the same name, [[Shinn Asuka]] from [[Gundam SEED Destiny]].

title: mystic_eyes_of_roses
body:
A type of [[Mystic Eyes]] introduced in [[Tsukihime (Remake)]].Originally owned by [[Rita Rozay-en]], being given to [[Noel]] when turned into a Dead Apostle [spoiler]by [[Dr. Arach]][/spoiler].

Called the world's most beautiful, most unsightly Mystic Eyes: they have the ability project the user's memories into other people's minds and implant a victim's mind into their body as a captive. [[Dead_Apostle Noel (Tsukihime)]] is able to forcibly remove the soul of her target and lock them away in her Mystic Eyes of Roses.

h4. Examples

* !post #9546339: Mystic Eye of Roses in use

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Mystic Eyes of Enchantment":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Rita_Rozay-en#Abilities

title: baltan_seijin
body:
A race of [[crustacean]]-like aliens from [[Ultraman (1st series)|]]. One of the most popular alien races from the franchise, often compared to the [[Dalek]]s from [[Doctor Who]]. Due to their popularity, and the wishes of their creator, Iijima Toshihiro, they've largely been phased out of antagonistic roles.

h4. See also

* [[Baltan Battler Barel]]

title: geronimon
body:
A [[feathers|feathered]] [[kaiju]] from episode 37 of [[Ultraman (1st Series)|]].

Due to its design resembling a [[caricature]] of a [[Native American]] chieftain, Geronimon has made no reappearances in the [[Ultra Series]] since its debut.

title: michael_richards'_laugh_factory_incident
body:
An incident that occurred on November 17, 2006 involving Michael Richards at the Laugh Factory comedy club in Hollywood.  Michael Richards, well known for his role as the character [[Cosmo Kramer]] in the TV show [[Seinfeld]], went on a racist rant while performing and responded to a small group of Black and Hispanic hecklers with racist profanity.

The incident was later parodied on several TV shows.

h4. External links
* "Video of the incident":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=amjUNF_R_PY]
* "Wikipedia: Michael Richards - 2006 Laugh Factory incident":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Richards#2006%E2%80%932012:_Laugh_Factory_incident_and_aftermath]

title: grand_theft_auto:_vice_city
body:
A follow-up to [[Grand Theft Auto III]], Grand Theft Auto: Vice City was another hit for the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series.

Vice City is known for its hypnotizing and nostalgic 80's influences, music and references. It is heavily influenced by the film [[Scarface]] and the television show [[Miami Vice]]. The game's setting is based off [[Miami]], [[florida (location)|Florida]].

h4. Characters
* [[Tommy Vercetti]]
* Ken Rosenberg
* Lance Vance
* Sonny Forelli
other_names: グランドセフトオートVC
グランドセフトオートバイスシティ

title: filia_(star_ocean)
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. Known as [b]Philia[/b] in later remakes. First seen in an optional Private Action in Kurik, which is needed to view a second PA in Central City to remove [[Gabriel (star ocean)|]]'s limiter. [spoiler]This Filia is an artificial version of the real Filia, who had been killed a long time ago. Her death caused her father Dr. Lantis to go mad and seek the annihilation of the universe, hoping to resurrect his daughter's consciousness in this Filia's body.[/spoiler]

title: shynesslady
body: A generic enemy encountered in [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]]. She is a buxom [[blonde hair|blonde-haired]] woman wearing a [[red dress]] and [[red gloves]] who wields a [[whip]]. Renamed to [b]Coquettish Whip[/b] in the English version.

title: claude_c._kenny
body: The main hero of [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] A Pangalactic officer and son of [[Ronyx J. Kenny]]. He accidentally winds up on the planet Expel and is caught up in the Sorcery Globe events along with [[Rena Lanford]].

title: rena_lanford
body: The main heroine of [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]]. A girl who meets [[Claude C. Kenny]] and journeys with him to find her real mother.

title: sporty_eyes
body:
A [[meme]] originated from [[Claude C. Kenny]] appeared in "Sakamoto Tarou's":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9D%82%E6%9C%AC%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E_%28%E6%BC%AB%E7%94%BB%E5%AE%B6%29 [[5koma]] manga. The manga was from [[Enix]]'s "Star Ocean Second Story Super Comic Gekijou Volume 7.":http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4757504462/ It's a parody of [[gameplay mechanics]] in [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] ([[Super Famicom]]/[[Super Nintendo]] version).

h4. External links

* "Original manga":http://hanatakayao4.tumblr.com/post/10848683070/78be58f1-jpg
* "Nicopedia article":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4976905

title: chisato_madison
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. An enthusiastic rookie reporter who follows the party around to get the latest scoop. She is also a master of jujitsu and uses a stun gun in battle. She doesn't bar any other characters from being recruited, but she is the final possible character to be recruited very late in the game.

title: noel_chandler
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A Nedian zoologist who loves taking care of animals. He doesn't bar recruitment of any characters, but he is the second last recruitable character in the game.
other_names: ノエル・チャンドラー

title: precis_neumann
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A plucky and energetic inventor who wants to be friends with the protagonists. Recruiting her makes it impossible to recruit [[Bowman Jean]].
other_names: プリシス・F・ノイマン

title: bowman_jean
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A married pharmacist working in the town of Linga. If he is recruited, it becomes impossible to recruit [[Precis Neumann]].

title: ernest_raviede
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. An archaeologist and adventurer who came to Expel. His girlfriend [[Opera Vectra]] chases after him. She must be in the party to recruit him, and if the player refuses to recruit him, she will leave with him.
other_names: エルネスト・レヴィード

title: opera_vectra
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A woman from the planet Tetragenesis who comes to Expel to find her lover [[Ernest Raviede]]. She must be in the party to recruit him, and if the player refuses to recruit Ernest, Opera will leave with him. Also, recruiting Opera makes it impossible to recruit [[Ashton Anchors]].

title: ashton_anchors
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A swordsman who had the bad fortune of being fused with a two-headed dragon, their heads protruding from his shoulders. If he is recruited, it becomes impossible to recruit [[Opera Vectra]] (and by extension [[Ernest Raviede]]).
other_names: アシュトン・アンカース

title: celine_jules
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A symbologist who travels the world searching for treasure. She can be recruited early on in either protagonist's storyline.

title: dias_flac
body: [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]] character. A stoic swordsman whose family was violently killed by bandits. He is only recruitable in [[rena lanford|Rena]]'s storyline.

title: kamikaze_kaitou_jeanne
body:
"God's Wind Thief Jeanne"

[b]Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne[/b] (also known as [b]Phantom-Thief Jeanne[/b]) is a fantasy shoujo manga series written and illustrated by [[Tanemura Arina]]. The story is about the adventures of a high school girl, [[Kusakabe Maron]], who is the reincarnation of [[Jeanne D'Arc]] and transforms into a [[magical girl]] "kaitou":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kait%C5%8D#Genre to collect the scattered pieces of God's power which are also coveted by [[demon]]s hiding in beautiful art works.

The manga was published by [i]Shueisha[/i] in [i]Ribon[/i] between February 1998 and July 2000. The individual chapters were collected and published in seven tankoubon volumes. It is licensed for English-language release by CMX Manga. The series was adapted by [[Toei Company]] as a 44-episode anime television series that was broadcast on [i][[TV Asahi]][/i] from February 1999 to January 2000. The series was re-issued by [i]Shueisha[/i] in 2007, with all chapters fitting into only 6 volumes, instead of the original 7; all volumes had new covers.

h4. External links

* "[i]Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne[/i] Manga Official Website":http://annex.s-manga.net/janne/
* "[i]Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne[/i] Anime Official Website":http://www.toei-anim.co.jp/lineup/tv/jeanne/
* "[i]Kamikaze Kaitou Jeanne[/i] at [i]Wikipedia[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamikaze_Kaito_Jeanne

title: dragon_ball_super
body:
The fourth [[Dragon Ball]] series created as the "definitive" sequel to [[Dragon Ball Z]], with the story being set 6 months after the defeat of [[Kid Buu]]. The anime began airing on July 5, 2015, with the manga appearing just slightly before on June 20. [[Toriyama Akira]] is credited for the "original story & character design concepts", in addition to his role as series creator, as well as providing more direct corrections and feedback for the manga. [[Toyotarou]], the Super mangaka, is also credited with "character design concepts".

Crucially, while the anime and manga follow the same base story notes provided by Toriyama, the way those notes are approached can differ significantly between the two, even when each side collaborates on select elements. While the anime has ended on March 25, 2018, with only new movies coming out since then, the manga has continued on.

[b]Directed by[/b]: Kimitoshi Chioka
[b]Produced by[/b]: [[Toei Company]]

title: one_piece
body:
A [[pirate]] adventure manga and anime series drawn by [[Oda Eiichirou]] in 1997 and the best-selling manga in Japan of all time. An animated adaptation was produced by [[Toei Company]] and a [[one piece (live action)|live action adaptation]] was later produced by [[Netflix]].

Set in a vast ocean world governed by the elusive World Government. The series follows [[Monkey D. Luffy]] and the crew of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] in search for the titular "One Piece", a treasure said to contain a world-changing power.

The series has a spinoff called [[Shokugeki no Sanji]], itself an off-shoot of [[Shokugeki no Souma]].

title: magne_robo_gakeen
body:
[b]Magne Robo Gakeen[/b] (マグネロボ・ガ・キーン, [i]Magunerobo Ga Kilina[/i]) is a [[Japan]]ese [[super robot]] anime TV series produced by [[Toei Company]]. 

It is the third installment to Takara's Magne-Robo Franchise. It aired from TV Asahi from September 5, 1976 to June 26, 1977, with a total of 39 episodes.

Outside of Japan several episodes were edited by Collins Walker and cobbled together into a movie-length feature produced by International Media Group and released by Century Video Corporation, and in this format it is also known as [b]Magnos the Robot[/b] or [b]Renegade Force[/b]. In Spanish speaking countries it is also known as [b]El Supermagnetron[/b].

h4. See also

* [[Gakeen]]
* [[Kazuki Mai (Gakeen)]]

title: daikuu_maryuu_gaiking
body:
The first [[Gaiking]] mecha anime series.

A 1976-1977 [[super robot]] series produced by [[Toei Company]], featuring [[Gaiking (dmg)|]] as the titular [[mecha]]. The series was created by [[Nagai Gou]], but he was uncredited in the original release, which led to a lengthy legal battle and falling out between Nagai and Toei. 

26 episodes were dubbed and aired in English as part of the [b]Force Five[/b] series in 1980. The full series was later licensed in English by Discotek Media, who released it under the title [b]Dino Mech Gaiking[/b].

title: yu-gi-oh!_(toei)
body:
A 1998 anime and the first adaptation of the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] manga series by [[Takahashi Kazuki]], produced by [[Toei Company]]. It adapts the first 59 chapters of the manga in a heavily abridged format, and is popularly known as [b]Season Zero[/b] by fans.

The series tells the story of [[muto yugi|Muto Yugi]], who after solving the ancient [[Millennium Puzzle]], awakens a [[Yami Yugi|gambling alter-ego]] within his body that solves his conflicts using various shadow games.

The anime is notable for retaining some of the aspects of the manga, such as various dangerous and oftentimes lethal games, as well as the overall psychological horror theme the series initially had. However, the popularity of the fictional "Magic & Wizards" card game (later known within the subsequent installments as [[Duel Monster]]s) caused the series to shift its focus almost exclusively to said card game.

It spawned a short-lived card game made by [[Bandai]] in 1998, before [[Konami]] acquired the exclusive rights for the card game which later became the current incarnation of the Yu-Gi-Oh! OCG/TCG.

The anime also had a theatrical movie released in 1999, which focused on [[Aoyama Shougo]] gaining the legendary [[Red-Eyes Black Dragon]] as he learns to bring out his confidence to duel.

It's succeeded by [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]].

title: castle_of_cagliostro
body:
[i]Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro[/i], also known as [i]Rupan Sansei: Kariosutoro no Shiro[/i], is a 1979 Japanese animated comedy-drama crime action film co-written and directed by [[Miyazaki Hayao]] as his feature film debut. 

It is the second feature film featuring Monkey Punch's master thief [[Arsene Lupin III]], from his manga series Lupin III.
 
The film was Miyazaki's first time directing a theatrical feature after having previously worked as an animator for [[Toei Company]] and TMS Entertainment and directing several shows including [[Lupin III]] and two episodes of [i]Lupin III Part II[/i].

American director [[Steven Spielberg]] considers a car chase sequence in the film as the best animated work of all time.
other_names: ルパン三世カリオストロの城

title: hokuto_no_ken
body:
[b]Hokuto no Ken[/b] (known as [b]Fist of the North Star[/b] in the west) is a Japanese [[post-apocalypse|post-apocalyptic]] action manga series and media franchises illustrated by [[Hara Tetsuo]] and written by Buronson. The manga was first published in 1982 on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]].

The original anime adaptation created by [[Toei Company]] in 1984 sparked a massive controversy due to the anime featured massive amount of violence (especially for its time when "Adult content air time" did not exist), most notably gore. leading to massive usage of censorship on the anime, and the creation of "Adult content air time", a slot of airing time on Television specifically for violent anime.

Nevertheless, the series' extreme violence and masculine-heavy theme had later inspired other action shounen and seinen manga and anime, particularly during late 80s and 90s era. Notable examples were [[jojo_no_kimyou_na_bouken|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]], [[Grappler Baki]], [[Bastard!!]] [[Sun-Ken Rock]], [[Berserk]] and recently [[Chainsaw Man]] and [[Jujutsu Kaisen]].

Due to the unique [[manly]] artstyle, heavely inspired by 80s Movies like [[Mad Max]] and [[Terminator]], the show is also frequently subjected to various [[parody]] comedy doujins that were usually revolved around turning various cute anime girl into a "[[hara_tetsuo_(style)|K-style]]" style macho women (mostly involves the character [[cosplay]] and attempt to roleplay as their respective character) for comedic effect.

h5. Story (anime adaptation)

Near the end of the 20th century, a nuclear war engulfed most of the Earth's surface, reducing most of the world into a vast desert wasteland. The survivors of mankind banded together in tribes in order to fight over the few supply of uncontaminated food and water still left in the world, with the strong often preying on the weak. [[Kenshiro]], the successor of the assassination art known as Hokuto Shinken, wanders the wasteland after being separated from his fiancee [[Yuria (Hokuto no Ken)|]] by his friend-turned-enemy [[Shin_(hokuto_no_ken)|Shin]]. Accompanied by two young children, [[Bat (Hokuto no Ken)|]] and [[Lin (hokuto no ken)|]], Ken becomes a savior to the weak and innocent from the various gangs and ruthless bandits threatening their survival. Throughout the course of his journey, Kenshiro encounters various formidable rivals and adversaries, ultimately culminating with Kenshiro's eldest adoptive brother [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|]], an oppressive tyrant who challenges Ken for the right of the Hokuto Shinken succession.

Several years afterward, Kenshiro reunites with the now grown Bat and Lynn in order to stand up against a corrupt Imperial Army. The three, with the help of other rebels, manage to expose a conspiracy within the Imperial Army to keep the Heavenly Empress ([spoiler]Lynn's estranged twin sister, Lui[/spoiler]) imprisoned. The Empress is saved, only for Lynn to be taken to the "Land of Asura", a country of warriors where only the mightiest survive. Kenshiro crosses to Asura in pursuit of her, only to find himself fighting against the three generals who rule over the land. [spoiler]Kenshiro finds himself fighting not only against his own blood brother Hyou, but also [[Kaioh (hokuto no ken)|Kaioh]], Raoh's own brother.[/spoiler]

h4. Characters

* [b][i]Hokuto Shinken[/i][/b]
** [[Kenshiro]]
** [[raoh (hokuto no ken)|Raoh]]
** [[toki (hokuto no ken)|Toki]]
** [[Jagi]]
** [[Ryuken (hokuto no ken)|]]
** [[koryu (hokuto no ken)|Kouryuu]]

title: toushou_daimos
body:
[b]Toushou Daimos[/b] (闘将ダイモス, [i]Tōshō Daimosu[/i]) is a [[Japan]]ese [[super robot]] anime TV series produced by [[Toei Company]] and animated by [[sunrise_(company)|Nippon Sunrise]].

It is directed by Nagahama Tadao as his last work. 

The series is the third and final installment of the "[[Robot]] Romance Trilogy", following [[Choudenji Robo Combattler V]] and [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]]. It aired on TV Asahi from April 1, 1978 to January 27, 1979, consisting of 44 episodes.

title: key_(company)
body:
A visual novel/game studio under Visual Art's, known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. 

Their more well-known works include: [[kanon|Kanon]], [[air (visual novel)|Air]], [[clannad|Clannad]] and [[angel_beats!|Angel Beats!]]. 

Kanon was Key's debut release, which combined an elaborate storyline, a modern anime-style drawing style, and a musical score to help set the mood for the game. 

Key's second game was Air. It had a similar if not more complex storyline to Kanon and a more thorough gameplay. 

Key's third game was Clannad and is their longest work, comprising of over 62,800 text lines. The game consists of two story arcs in the game: the School Life arc, and the After Story arc (which is set 10 years after the School Life arc).

Both Kanon and Air were originally produced as adult eroges games(only Clannad was not), but had non-ero console ports released for the Dreamcast, PS2, XBox 360 and PSP. 

Four of Key's works, Kanon, Air, Clannad and Little Busters! have been made into anime. Key supervised the production of these anime titles while working with three animation studios [[Toei Company]], [[Kyoto Animation]] and [[J.C. Staff|J.C.Staff]].

h4. Works:

title: interstella_5555
body:
[b]Interstella 5555: The 5tory of the 5ecret 5tar 5ystem[/b] (インターステラ5555, Intāsutera Fō Faibu?, "Four Five") is a feature-length Japanese animated musical film originally released on December 1, 2003.

The film is the visual realization of [i]Discovery[/i], an album by the [[France|French]] electronic music duo [[Daft Punk]]. Each track from the album has been animated as an episode in the story of the abduction and rescue of an interstellar pop band. 

The film was produced by Daft Punk, Cédric Hervet and Emmanuel de Buretel along with [[Toei Company]], under the supervision of [[Matsumoto Leiji]]. The film has no dialogue and minimal sound effects.

title: saint_seiya
body:
[b]Saint Seiya[/b], also known as [b]Saint Seiya: Knights of the Zodiac[/b], is a 1986 Japanese [[fantasy]] and [[martial arts]] action manga series created, written and illustrated by [[Kurumada Masami (style)|]].

It was serialized first in [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] from 1986 to 1990, with the chapters collected into 28 tankōbon volumes by Shueisha. 

The story follows five mystical warriors called the "Saints" (or "Knights" in some adaptations) who fight wearing sacred armors named "Cloths", the designs of which derive from the various constellations the characters have adopted as their destined guardian symbols, and empowered by a mystical energy called "Cosmo". The Saints have sworn to defend the reincarnation of the benevolent Greek goddess [[Athena (saint seiya)|]] in her battle against other evil Olympian and Norse mythology gods who want to dominate Earth.

The manga was adapted into an anime television series by [[Toei Company]] with character designs and art by [[Araki Shingo]] that ran from 1986 to 1989, before being continued in the form of three original video animation series between 2002 and 2008. 

Four animated feature films were shown in Japanese theaters from 1987 to 1989, with a fifth in 2004 and a sixth in 2014. 

Since 2006, creator Kurumada published a sequel manga titled [[Saint Seiya: Next Dimension]]. Several spin-off manga by different authors have also been created, as well as a standalone anime and original net animation.

Saint Seiya has been very successful, with over 34 million copies sold in Japan alone. The series began to be known in the west after it became popular in France in 1988, where it was given the French name of [i]Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque[/i]; this was also the first foreign release of the series. Since the early 90s the series also became very popular in Spanish-speaking countries after it was released in Spain as "Los Caballeros del Zodiaco". 

Because of its popularity many RPG, action and fighting video games based on the series have been released in the last decades.

title: koutetsu_jeeg
body:
[b]Koutetsu Jeeg[/b] (鋼鉄ジーグ [i]Kōtetsu Jīgu[/i]), also known as [b]Steel Jeeg[/b] in English speaking countries and "El Vengador" ([b]The Avenger[/b]) in Spanish speaking ones, is a [[super robot]] anime and manga series created by manga artists [[Nagai Gou]] and Yasuda Tatsuya. 

The anime television series was produced by [[Toei Company]]. It was first broadcast on Japanese TV in 1975. 

The 1970s series lasted for 46 episodes. Steel Jeeg also ran as a manga in several children's publications.

A sequel series called [[Koutetsushin Jeeg]] (which appears to take place 50 years after the original show) aired on the satellite network WOWOW, beginning April 5, 2007.

h4. See also

* [[Koutetsu Jeeg (Mecha)]]
* [[Jeeg-san]]

title: tiger_mask_(series)
body:
A Japanese [[wrestling]] manga series written by Ikki Kajiwara and illustrated by Naoki Tsuji.

The series was first published in Kodansha's Bokura Magazine from 1968 to 1969 and was later published in Weekly Shōnen Magazine from 1970 to 1971. It was later adapted into an anime series by [[Toei Company]] which first aired on Yomiuri TV on October 2, 1969 and ended its run on September 30, 1971, airing 105 episodes. 

The series revolves around Date Naoto, better known by his ring name [[Tiger Mask (character)|]], a heel-turned-face wrestler who fought to take care of an orphanage he secretly taken care of under his real name against his former master, an evil wrestling promoter known as Mr. X.

title: sonic_cd
body:
A [[1993]] video game developed by [[Sega]] for the [[Sega CD]]. Developed by [[Sonic Team]], it is the third installment in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] Series, along with [[Toei Company]], who helped make the intro. Known for having two distinct soundtracks, one released in Japan and Europe, the other being released in North America.

[[Metal Sonic]] and [[Amy Rose]] made their video game debuts in this game.

title: star_wars
body:
An epic American space opera franchise created by filmmaker [[George Lucas]], originally produced by Lucasfilms before [[Disney]] later acquired the rights in 2012. It is a [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] story set in a faraway galaxy, chronicling the galactic-scale conflict between the benevolent [[Jedi]] and the evil [[Sith]] faction.

The Star Wars saga has had a significant impact on popular culture; is one of the highest-grossing media franchises of all time. Because of its success across the world during the late 1970s, several Japanese anime and manga from that era were heavily inspired by it.

title: hono
body:
The scenarist and illustrator of Japanese indie developer [i]Orange_Juice[/i].
In real life, he is also a Seiyuu under his real name, Fujiwara Hikaru.
When [i][[100% orange juice|100% Orange Juice]][/i] became voiced, he ended up voicing four of his creations: Sky Pirate Tequila from [i][[Flying Red Barrel]][/i], Arthur from [i]Xmas Shooting[/i], NoName from [i]Acceleration of SUGURI[/i], and Shifu from [i]SUGURI[/i].

title: kiriko_(orange_juice)
body:
Character from the [i][[QP Shooting]][/i] series, originating first in [i]Christmas Shooting[/i]. A nurse with a proclivity for strange concoctions and "surgeries" who is somehow part of a gang of bullying teenagers.

In [i][[100% orange juice|100% Orange Juice]][/i], she is voiced by [[Sakura Miko]]. She would also be given costumes which are basically [[sakura_miko_(cosplay)|cosplays of her first and second costumes]].

title: 100%_orange_juice
body:
A game by [i]Orange_Juice[/i]. What was once an obscure game released in Comiket 76 celebrating the 5th year of the doujin circle became something of a runaway success when it was released to a wider audience with its English localization by Fruitbat Factory in 2013 and particularly its Steam release in 2014.

What started as a select cast of 12 characters soon expanded to over 60 characters, all are from previous (and [i][[alicianrone|future]][/i]) [i]Orange_Juice[/i] games or original characters created specifically for the game.

title: himemori_luna_(streetwear)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Himemori Luna]], revealed on July 30th 2023. According to Luna, she specifically requested a "sexy" design to make a contrast with her normally cute-themed costumes.

The costume consists of an open cherry [[red jacket|red]] [[letterman jacket]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[grey vest|grey]] [[cropped vest]] and a [[chest harness]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] decorated with a [[black overskirt]], with [[black panties|black]] [[panty straps]] visible, a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[torn thighhighs]] [[grey thighhighs|grey thighhigh]] and [[black boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has [[short hair]] with [[long bangs]] [[diagonal bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], a [[side braid]] on the left decorated with a [[hair ribbon]], and a [[heart-shaped eyewear|heart-shaped]] [[sunglasses]] on her head. She now has [[purple hair|purple]] [[colored inner hair]].

On "May 15th, 2025":[https://www.youtube.com/live/MguHzFvFFTA], she introduced the [[high ponytail]] type of hairstyle.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15445230: Profile (short hair)
* !asset #25837096: Profile (high ponytail)
* !post #6538969: Reference sheet
* !post #6538539: Merchandise

title: crosshair_pupils
body:
Pupils which resemble a [[crosshair]]. The crosshair shape often extends beyond the pupil into the iris and/or sclera.

Notably seen in the eyes of [[Hatsume Mei]], [[Boothill (Honkai: Star Rail)|Boothill]], [[Dtto.]], [[Eines (Dolphin Wave)|Eines]], and [[Nacht (Dolphin Wave)|Nacht]], among others.
 
Not to be confused with [[cross-shaped pupils]].

title: jia_qiu_(project_moon)
body:
An antagonist [spoiler] and later supporting character[/spoiler] in [[Limbus Company]]. Based off of the ancient Chinese philosopher "Confucius":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confucius. 

[spoiler] It's revealed that Jia Qiu's real name is Kong Qiu, and he's the last surviving member of the Kong family.

[spoiler] It's additionally revealed he is secretly a member of the Pinky, known as Five Mangs(五望) of the Tiangang Star.[/spoiler]

title: stargate_(series)
body:
A military science fiction media franchise based on the 1994 film of the same name. It is centered around the eponymous Stargate, a large ring-shaped device of ancient alien origin that acts as a portal to other Stargates located throughout the galaxy.

The franchise is based on the ancient alien trope where aliens visited Earth in the past and helped raise early human civilization. The aliens, known as Goa'ulds, enslaved humanity until a rebellion drove them off Earth and buried their Stargate to prevent them from returning. The franchise proper takes place in modern times where the Stargate has been secretly rediscovered and taken by the U.S. military. They use it to explore alien worlds while battling the Goa'uld who have gone to conquer the rest of the galaxy.

Besides the original 1994 film, the franchise consists of several series and movies including:

* [[Stargate SG-1]]
* [[Stargate: Atlantis]]
* [[Stargate Universe]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article: Stargate":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stargate]

title: stargate_sg-1
body:
An American-Canadian [[military]] [[science fiction]] television show running from 1997-2007, based on the 1994 film [[Stargate (series)|]].

The show is based around the titular [i]Stargate[/i], ancient alien devices located throughout the galaxy that can open up wormholes allowing travel from one to another. The show follows the adventures of SG-1, the main team of a secret military organization tasked with exploring new worlds and battling interstellar threats.

The series has inspired two spinoff series and several movies.

h4. Characters

* [[Daniel Jackson]]
* [[Jack O'neill]]
* [[Samantha Carter]]
* [[Teal'c]]

h4. See also

* [[Stargate (series)]]
* [[Stargate: Atlantis]]
* [[Stargate Universe]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article: Stargate SG-1":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stargate_SG-1]

title: shina_(star_ocean)
body:
A character from the [[Star Ocean]] series, whom appeared only in the CD Drama version of [[Star Ocean: The Second Story]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with [[purple hair|purple]] [[colored tips|tips]] that hangs [[hair between eyes|between]] her [[purple eyes]], and has [[animal ears]] with [[earrings]]. Her outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]] underneath a [[white jacket]], a [[purple belt]] around a [[white skirt]], [[black pantyhose]] with [[knee boots|knee-high]] [[purple boots|purple]] [[platform boots]], and [[purple gloves|purple]] [[fingerless gloves]]. Her weapon is an [[ornate weapon|orante]] [[sword]] that has an [[ornament]] of a [[monster]].

title: star_ocean:_the_second_story
body: The second game in tri-Ace's [[Star Ocean]] series, and the first to be localized to the west on the Playstation in 1999. It was remade and re-released for the PSP in 2008-2009 and for the PS3, PS4, and PS Vita in 2015 (Japan only) under the title [i]Star Ocean: Second Evolution[/i]. A second remake under the title [i]Star Ocean: The Second Story R[/i] was released on Nintendo Switch in November 2023.
other_names: スターオーシャンセカンドストーリー

title: star_ocean:_first_departure
body: The first game in the [[Star Ocean]] series, released in 1996 by tri-Ace but never localized to the west. [i]First Departure[/i] is the 2008 PSP enhanced remake of the Super Famicom version. The gameplay greatly resembles what is seen in [[Tales of Phantasia]] because most of the staff had left Namco after disagreements with Phantasia's development and formed tri-Ace to produce this game.

title: jia_huan_(project_moon)
body:
The older brother of [[Hong Lu (Project Moon)|]] and a recurring antagonist in [[Limbus Company]]. Based off of Jia Huan from "Dream of the Red Chamber":https://limbuscompany.wiki.gg/wiki/Jia_Huan. 

From Canto 8 onwards, he wears the E.G.O equipment [[Contempt Awe (e.g.o)|]] from [[Spiral Of Contempt]]. 

[Spoiler] His real name is currently unknown, as after the death of his younger brother [[Daguanyuan's Jia Huan (Project Moon)|]], he took on his name.

title: ready_player_one
body:
A 2011 [[science fiction]] novel, and the debut work of American author Ernest Cline. 

The story, set in a dystopian 2045, follows teen [[otaku]] protagonist [[Wade Owen Watts]] on his adventures searching for an easter egg in a worldwide virtual reality MMO video game called "OASIS", the discovery of which could lead him to inherit the late game creator's massive megafortune and total control and ownership of the game. 

A film adaptation was released on March 29, 2018 in most countries. It premiered in Japan on April 20, 2018.

h4. Characters

* [[Samantha Cook]] ([spoiler]"[[Art3mis]]"[/spoiler])

* [[Zhou (ready player one)|]] ([spoiler]"[[Shoto]]"[/spoiler])
* [[Nolan Sorrento]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ready Player One (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ready_Player_One_(film)]

title: kamen_rider_build
body:
Titular protagonist of [[Kamen Rider Build (series)|]], Sento Kiryu is an amnesiac scientist working for Touto, one of the three governments of a Japan physically and politically split by a massive wall created by the Pandora's Box, a mysterious artifact brought from Mars. Besides scientific work, he also moonlights as Build, fighting off the Smash, mutated humans experimented upon by the mysterious Faust organization.

As Build, Sento uses Fullbottles, which were his own creation, to change his appearance and combat capabilities, using a combination of Fullbottles based on organic and inorganic matter, such as his default blue-and-red [[Kamen Rider Build (RabbitTank form)|RabbitTank]] form.

title: sliver_(magic:_the_gathering)
body:
Slivers are creatures from the series [[Magic: The Gathering]]. They share a hive mind that allows them to share their abilities with other nearby slivers.  The original slivers were depicted with an armored vertebrate body, a long bifurcated whip-like tail, one arm with a single talon for a hand, and a singular head with an armored crest.  The ability of a sliver further builds and creates different variations of this base design.  Some particularly evolved forms of sliver have a humanoid appearance.

h4. External links

* "Gatherer card search: sliver":[https://gatherer.wizards.com/search?instanceSubtype=eq~sliver]
* "Magic: The Gathering Wiki - Sliver":[https://mtg.fandom.com/wiki/Sliver]

title: alien_(series)
body:
An action/horror [[science fiction]] media franchise produced by [[20th Century Studios]]. 

The original [[Alien (1979)|1979 film]] follows [[Ellen Ripley]] and her encounters with the [[Xenomorph]]s. The success of the first film spawned a media franchise of novels, comic books, [[video game]]s, and toys, as well as three sequel and three prequel films, and the story of her character Ripley's encounters with the Alien creatures became the thematic thread that ran through the sequel [[Aliens (1986)|]] (1986), [[Alien 3]] (1992) and [[Alien Resurrection]] (1997). 

The subsequent prequels [[Alien vs. Predator]] (2004) and Alien vs. Predator: Requiem (2007) abandoned this theme in favor of a crossover with the [[Predator (1987)|]] franchise.

h4. See also

* [[H.R. Giger]]

title: wallace_&_gromit
body:
A British clay stop-motion cartoon series created by Aardman revolving around [[Wallace (wallace & gromit)|]] and his dog, [[Gromit]].

Four short films have been released, along with two feature films:

* [i]A Grand Day Out[/i] (1989)
* [i]The Wrong Trousers[/i] (1993)
* [i]A Close Shave[/i] (1995)
* [i]The Curse of the Were-Rabbit[/i] (2005)
* [i]A Matter Of Loaf and Death[/i] (2008)
* [i]Vengeance Most Fowl[/i] (2024)

The [[Shaun the Sheep]] spin-off series emerged out of this franchise.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Wallace & Gromit":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wallace_&_Gromit]
* "Official website":[https://www.wallaceandgromit.com/]

title: this_is_sparta_(meme)
body:
An internet [[meme]] from the movie [[300 (movie)|]]. A quote said by the character [[Leonidas I]], the King of Sparta, just before kicking a [[Persia]]n messenger down a [[well]]. 

In the scene it originated from, a Persian messenger asks King Leonidas for a tribute of earth and water, as a token of Sparta's submission to Persia. In response, Leonidas draws his sword and points it at the messenger and forces the messenger toward the ledge of a deep well. The messenger tells Leonidas "That this is blasphemy. This is madness!" To which Leonidas responds with "Madness? This is Sparta!" and kicks the Persian messenger into the well. 

h4. External link

* "YouTube: This is Sparta. Full Scene":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QkWS9PiXekE

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]] with [[double bun|double]] [[takodachi (ninomae ina'nis)|]]-shaped [[bun with braided base|buns with braided base]] with regular [[long sidelocks]] instead of her [[tentacle hair]] (although she can move her hair tentacles to the top of her head, giving the impression of [[horns]]) and a [[hair flower]].

title: hatsume_mei
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

An eccentric girl from the Support Department with a knack for inventing hero equipment, which she refers to as her "babies". Despite her talent, she lacks social skills and can be reckless at times.

She has pink hair and yellow eyes with [[symbol-shaped pupils]] that are shaped like a [[crosshair pupils|crosshair]]. She always wears [[goggles on head|goggles on her head]].

title: selen_tatsuki
body:
A former [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the second wave [[Obsydia (nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[Kamameshi Gougoumaru]]. She was canonically the sister of [[Elira Pendora]] from the first wave [[LazuLight]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[purple hair]] in [[twin braids]] with [[hairclip|hairclips]] and [[ahoge]], [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[purple eyes]], and [[pointy ears]] that are usually obscured by her [[purple wings|purple]] [[head wings]]. 

She was terminated on February 5th, 2024 following a month-long hiatus, which later sparked a massive controversy regarding Nijisanji's treatment of their talent after the reason behind her hiatus came to light.

title: jean_bart_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the French battleship [i]Jean Bart[/i]. Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]].

She has [[pale skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], [[blue eyes]], two [[mole under eye|moles under her left eye]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] patterned [[strapless shirt]] with [[bare shoulders]], a long [[scarf]] that is designed off her real-life camouflage pattern, [[beret]], and black [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her two 380 mm quad main gun mounts, one on each side.

Hastily evacuated half-complete as the Germans took over France, the historical [i]Jean Bart[/i] was at anchor in Casablanca (assigned to Vichy France after 1940 armistice), when the Allies took the base in November 1942 (the setting of the Summer 2022 event), leading to her gunnery exchange with [[Massachusetts (kancolle)|]] where she was severely damaged. She was then handled over to the Allies after, she was not completed until 1949 and decommissioned a decade later.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5878273: [[Jean Bart (Christmas) (Kancolle)|Christmas]]

title: korwa
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

An [[Erune]] fashion designer that uses a [[quill]] and [[easel]]. Her eyes are [[blue eyes|blue]] and her hair is [[long hair|long]] and light [[grey hair|grey]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears an elaborately patterned, [[showgirl skirt]]-like [[asymmetrical clothes|monochromatic]] dress with a feathered collar and [[thighhighs]]. Her outfit is sparsely adorned with gold jewelry with the most prominent piece being a large [[hair ornament]] on the left side of her head.

Sometimes paired up with [[lunalu (granblue fantasy)|Lunalu]] due to the fact that they are both illustrators.

Known less for her character and more for being absurdly overpowered when she was first released. Her skills could last for [b]hundreds[/b] of turns and casted [b]nearly every[/b] buff. To make a comparison, the longest buffs in the game may last for only five or so turns. The sheer absurdity of her skills made even beginner players do ludicrous amounts of endgame damage. Veteran players were able to beat the hardest raids in the game with ease by themselves in minuscule time with her. Nearly a day after her release she was given a harsh nerf followed by a public apology and a distribution of refunds given to those who rolled in the gacha during the period of time between her release and nerf.

title: dorothy_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

The leader of [[Inherit (nikke)|]], Dorothy serves as a guide for newcomers within Eden, a remote place situated on the surface where humans and Nikkes coexist. Her courteous facade hides an insidious and cruel personality.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] a in [[side braid]] and a [[side up bun]] on the left side, along with [[pink eyes|pink]]/[[purple eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. Her regular outfit consists of a [[see-through dress|see-through]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves]] which partially shows her [[white panties]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[high heels]]. She can transform into her battle form which consist of [[armored dress]] with [[horns|horn]]-like [[headgear]], [[bracer]], [[mechanical wings]], and [[armored boots]].

In the earliest days of the Rapture invasion, Dorothy served as a member of the [[Goddess (Nikke)|]] squad, consisting of her, [[Liliweiss (nikke)|]], [[Snow White (Innocent Days) (nikke)|Snow White]], [[Scarlet (Black Shadow) (nikke)|Scarlet]], [[Red Hood (nikke)|]] and [[Rapunzel (nikke)|]]. She took the role of acting leader after Liliweiss's untimely death. Like other Goddess squad members, she is named after a children's novel character instead of a Biblical figure. In this case, she is named after [[Dorothy Gale]], the protagonist of the [[The Wizard of Oz]].

Illustrator: [[Yoya Yogurt]]
Voice Actress: [[Saitou Chiwa]] (JP)

h4. Appearance

title: falcon_punch
body:
The signature move of [[Captain Falcon]], which consists of winding up a [[punching|punch]], usually with one's [[flaming hand|fist covered in fire]], and then throwing the mighty blow with a [[falcon]] made of fire erupting from that hand.

This special move does not exist in the [[F-ZERO]] series and first appeared in [[Super Smash Bros.]]
[spoiler]In the final episode of [[F-ZERO Falcon Densetsu]], it was used to deliver the finishing blow to [[Black Shadow (f-zero)|]].
At that time, there was no flame in the form of a falcon, but instead blue lightning was produced.[/spoiler]

title: blood_falcon
body:
A [[F-Zero]] racer, the pilot of the Blood Hawk and subordinate of [[Black Shadow (f-zero)|]]. 

A clone of [[Captain Falcon]], created with stolen DNA during Captain Falcon's hospitalization after the Huge Accident 3 years ago prior to F-Zero X. His equal in every way.
other_names: ブラッド・ファルコン

title: black_shadow_(f-zero)
body:
[[F-Zero]] racer and the pilot of the [[Black Bull]]. The feared evil Space Emperor and the arch-nemesis of [[Captain Falcon]].

Tired of his henchmen continually being captured and his plans thwarted by the bounty hunter, he enters the F-Zero races with the sole purpose of killing Captain Falcon in front of billions of spectators across the galaxy.

title: ninja_to_koroshiya_no_futarigurashi
body:
An original, comedy manga created by [[hundredburger]]. An anime adaption started airing in April 2025.

On the way home from school one day, [[Koga Konoha]] rescues [[Kusagakure Satoko]], a [[ninja]] who escaped her village. Soon, pursuers from the village show up in search of Satoko only to be deftly dealt with by Konoha. As it turns out, the unassuming high schooler is actually an assassin. Thus, the potentially cutthroat cohabitation of a ninja and an assassin begins!

h4. Characters

title: royce_and_royce_(umamusume)
body:
A character in the [[Umamusume (anime)|]] anime who made her appearance in the third season, initially as a background character with only the last letter of her name visible, who happened to be part of Team Canopus. She would formally be introduced in Episode 12, just hours after her profile was released.

This dramaturge of a thoroughbred wants to cast herself in the role of "The Strongest".

Her obsession about that title is based around the fact that the original horse was (jokingly or not) given various variants of the title of "The Strongest X", where "X" meant "maiden horse", "single win horse" or "third place horse" at various times due to how often victory eluded the real [[Royce and Royce (racehorse)|]].

Voiced by [[Tanabe Rui]].

h4. Appearance

title: boc'z_(umamusume)
body:
Five-person vocal group and unit in [[Umamusume]] originally debuting on April Fools' 2023 with a music video ([i]"Hat on Your Head!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BzRmdQioIQU][/i]) and a mock website listing the group's manifesto with personalized bios for each unit member as though they were a real-life music group.

BoC'z is a wordplay that can be read as "boushis" in Japanese (literally "The Hats"). Its members are all hat-wearing umamusume and consist of the following:

* [[Matikanetannhauser (boc'z) (umamusume)|816-n]] ([[Matikanetannhauser (umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Rice Shower (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|ORYZA]] ([[Rice Shower (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Mr. C.B. (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|CAP.B]] ([[Mr. C.B. (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Hokko Tarumae (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|MACOtMai]] ([[Hokko Tarumae (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Cheval Grand (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|MARINE.C]] ([[Cheval Grand (Umamusume)|]])

For 5th Event -YELL-, the rest of the [[V Sisters]] were added to the formation:
* [[verxina (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|QueenV]] ([[Verxina (Umamusume)|]])
* [[vivlos (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Lil♡V]] ([[Vivlos (Umamusume)|]])

For April Fools' 2025, three new groups take their places with some old and new faces, collectively called [b]BoC'z we\n[/b]. They consist of the following:

* The [[beanie]]-wearing [b]AM-i[/b], consisting of:
** [[nakayama festa (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Ata Mahane]] ([[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]])
** [[rice shower (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Oryza]] (Rice Shower)

* The [[bucket hat]]-wearing [b]OK→U[/b] (read "OK for you"), consisting of:
** [[north flight (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|F-Style]] ([[North Flight (umamusume)|]])
** [[loves only you (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|<3]] ([[Loves Only You (umamusume)|]], read "Love")

* The [[baseball cap]]-wearing [b]CΛ²[/b], consisting of all of the V Sisters:
** [[verxina (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Queen V]] (Verxina)
** [[cheval grand (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Marine.C]] (Cheval Grand)
** [[vivlos (boc'z we\n) (umamusume)|Lil♡V]] (Vivlos)

[tn](For each version of BoC'z, Pseudonyms were stylized as above with spaces and capitalization exactly as written.)[/tn]

h4. See also

* [[UMA STARS (Umamusume)]] (April Fools 2024)

title: matikanetannhauser_(boc'z)_(umamusume)
body:
[[Matikanetannhauser (umamusume)|]] as 816-n of the [[Boc'z (Umamusume)|]] unit.

Wears [[black pants]], a grey [[sports bra]] with "BOUSHIS" printed on the bottom elastic, a [[black jacket]] worn off-shoulders and the requisite "Boc'z" black [[baseball cap]] with ear outlets, worn off-center on her [b]right ear[/b] as it is typical from Machitan.

"816-n" is an obfuscated version of her catch phase as it is meant to be read as [[ei ei mun!|"Ei Mun"]].

title: starting_future_(umamusume)
body:
[tn]"Generic Competition Uniform"[/tn]

A [[white jacket]] with [[purple thighhighs]], maroon [[shorts]] & [[midriff]]-baring race costume that all [[Umamusume]] horse girl characters (those that already appeared in game) have access to. Often worn by those assuming backup dancer roles in Winning Lives, such as Make Debut. In the game, it serves as a girls' initial racing outfit they have access to if they are [b]2 stars or lower[/b] prior to awakening, wherein they'll switch to their main racing uniform once they've reached [b]3 stars[/b].

Use only the tag if any Umamusume characters wearing it, [b]this doesn't apply to their actual racing "competition outfit".[/b]

title: tatakae_namu
body:
Tatakae Namu ([i]Fight, Namu[/i]) was a manga by George Akiyama, running from Sep 1, 1976 to Aug 1, 1977.

It follows the adventures of a monk named Alexander Namu as he fights evil with his companion Ami.

title: egypt
body:
A country located on the northeastern Africa, exactly at the end of the Nile river. Famous for its ancient culture.

On Danbooru, this tag applies to posts featuring the country of Egypt, including both ancient and modern Egypt. Don't apply this tag simply because the post features incidental [[Ancient Egyptian]] elements (ex. a character wearing [[Ancient Egyptian clothes|Ancient Egyptian]]-themed clothing).

body:

title: great_pyramid_of_giza
body:
A massive necropolis complex located in [[Egypt]], mainly comprised of three large [[pyramid (structure)|]]s; the titular Great Pyramid built by Khufu, the slightly smaller one built by Khafre, and the smallest of three built by Menkaure, accompanied by over 50 smaller pyramids and the [[great sphinx of giza|great sphinx]]. It was the tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years.

This tag is specifically used for the Great Pyramids complex, and is applicable when any distingushing features were found in the post (i.e the great sphinx). Otherwise tag [[pyramid (structure)|]] for a generic pyramid landscape instead.

h4. See also

* [[Chichen Itza]]

title: kampfer_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0080]].

[b]MS-18E Kämpfer[/b]

A high-speed prototype assault [[mobile suit]] created by [[Zeon]]. Intended for close combat, it prioritized speed and armament over any sort of armor protection, being loaded with a variety of weapons - including [[chain_mine|chain mines]], [[bazooka_(gundam)|bazookas]], [[shotgun|shotguns]], [[energy sword|beam sabers]], and [[panzerfaust|panzerfausts]]. 

Piloted by veteran Zeon [[soldier]] [[Mikhail Kaminsky]].

[spoilers]The only known unit was deployed in a colony in [[gundam_0080|the final days of the One Year War]], where it rampaged and destroyed several [[Earth Federation]] [[mecha]] until being destroyed itself by the [[Gundam Alex]].[/spoilers]

For the light novel series, see [[kampfer]].

title: emma_frost
body:
A telepath from [[X-Men]] that can also turn her body into diamond.

She has [[blonde hair]], [[blue lips]], [[large breasts]], and wears a [[superhero costume]] made up of a white [[crop top]] or [[corset]]-like clothing ([[revealing clothes]]) and a [[cape]]. In [[Marvel Rivals]], she instead wears a [[white leotard]].

title: rocket_raccoon
body:
An anthropomorphic alien [[raccoon]] character from the [[Marvel]] universe.

Originally a minor and relatively obscure character, he gained fame as a member of the rebooted [[Guardians of the Galaxy]]. Known for his short-temper, expertise with guns, and occasional reluctance to being called a raccoon.

title: squirrel_girl_(marvel)
body:
A [[Marvel]] character, real name Doreen Green. A girl who was born with [[squirrel]] features and ability to communicate with squirrels.

Originally an obscure character, she became a fan-favorite in the internet age after her feats of defeating fearsome villains such as [[Doctor Doom]] became common knowledge. She's commonly depicted as a "meta character" who knows she's in a comic book and understands narrative conventions.

h4. External links

* "Marvel.com: Squirrel Girl (Doreen Green)":https://www.marvel.com/characters/squirrel-girl-doreen-green
* "Wikipedia: Squirrel Girl":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squirrel_Girl
